Title: Analytics & Insights - Western Europe, Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Do you want to make a huge impact, step-change eCommerce business decisions and drive growth through data and insight?

If you are you a strong communicator, curious-minded, with a passion for data analysis – then join our team! You can unleash your potential in an ambitious, fun, and diverse organization and experience the LEGO® adventure!


Core Responsibilities





Deliver commercial performance analysis and insights drumbeat of Amazon and B2B eCommerce within Western Europe
Provide regular performance analysis to a wide range of team-members across Western Europe
Be a trusted analytics partner who generates recommendations that accelerate growth and influence collaborators
Triangulate first and third-party data sources to generate insights through data analysis
Ensure data flows are accurate and robust
Supply the eCommerce team with a suite of dashboarding and self-serve analysis tools
Work with dedicated colleagues from across the wider A&I organisation and Data Engineers / Data Scientists to design and build data solutions to expedite rapid decision making
Conduct deep dives and incremental analysis into performance and generate practical insights – particularly supporting key events such as Prime Day, Black Friday
Support delivery of advanced analytics and the move from descriptive to predictive analytics




Play your part in our team succeeding

You will be part of the Western Europe Analytics & Insight team composed of A&I leaders located across Western Europe. Our mission is to empower and influence the business to make the right commercial decisions and shape strategy, with unbiased insights and recommendations. You will report and analyse business performance, ensuring data integrity and accelerating growth thanks to a deep shopper understanding and a strong ability to identify and influence business decisions.

Partnering with the Western Europe B2B eCommerce team, who are accountable for growing sales through Amazon, and building up commercial capabilities on eCommerce, you will play a meaningful role in influencing short- and long-term decision-making through practical data insights.

We are looking for an analyst who will support with the understanding of business performance and identifying growth opportunities across markets, audience, and products, delivering the trading drumbeat and creating data solutions for the team. This role will support optimisation of the entire shopper funnel, and in conjunction with the wider A&I Team, enable marketing and operational strategies to ultimately drive commercial results.

Ultimately, the A&I partner uncovers unexpected insights to help The LEGO Group reach more consumers.

Do you have what it takes?

The requirements to succeed in this role are the following





Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience in the data industry
Ability to influence the course of business through sharp analysis, effective communication and strong business acumen; identifying commercial opportunities
Proficiency in managing a mix of datasets from different sources to analyse commercial performance
Strong analytical skills, robust commercial acumen and strength in deriving commercially valuable insights from data
Expertise in managing analytics tools and Data Query coding (e.g.,SQL, Python)
Business Intelligence & Reporting Tools (e.g., Power BI)
Good awareness of common Data Analytics techniques, together with advanced Data Visualisation Skills
Strong communications and presentation skills – able to communicate complex data analysis to a non-technical audience in a simple way
Strong collaboration skills
Fluency to work in English




Moreover, it would be an advantage if you demonstrate





Experience with Data Science and Advanced Analytics Techniques (Exploratory Data Analysis, Classification, Regression, Clustering)
Experience of the Amazon ecosystem, including Amazon Platform, Data, and Tools (i.e., Retail Platform, Amazon Advertising Platform, Amazon Marketing Cloud)
Experience working in the Consumer Good industry and/or in eCommerce




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. For all candidates, if you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Do you want to make a huge impact, step-change eCommerce business decisions and drive growth through data and insight?

If you are you a strong communicator, curious-minded, with a passion for data analysis – then join our team! You can unleash your potential in an ambitious, fun, and diverse organization and experience the LEGO® adventure!


Core Responsibilities



  • Deliver commercial performance analysis and insights drumbeat of Amazon and B2B eCommerce within Western Europe
  • Provide regular performance analysis to a wide range of team-members across Western Europe
  • Be a trusted analytics partner who generates recommendations that accelerate growth and influence collaborators
  • Triangulate first and third-party data sources to generate insights through data analysis
  • Ensure data flows are accurate and robust
  • Supply the eCommerce team with a suite of dashboarding and self-serve analysis tools
  • Work with dedicated colleagues from across the wider A&I organisation and Data Engineers / Data Scientists to design and build data solutions to expedite rapid decision making
  • Conduct deep dives and incremental analysis into performance and generate practical insights – particularly supporting key events such as Prime Day, Black Friday
  • Support delivery of advanced analytics and the move from descriptive to predictive analytics



Play your part in our team succeeding

You will be part of the Western Europe Analytics & Insight team composed of A&I leaders located across Western Europe. Our mission is to empower and influence the business to make the right commercial decisions and shape strategy, with unbiased insights and recommendations. You will report and analyse business performance, ensuring data integrity and accelerating growth thanks to a deep shopper understanding and a strong ability to identify and influence business decisions.

Partnering with the Western Europe B2B eCommerce team, who are accountable for growing sales through Amazon, and building up commercial capabilities on eCommerce, you will play a meaningful role in influencing short- and long-term decision-making through practical data insights.

We are looking for an analyst who will support with the understanding of business performance and identifying growth opportunities across markets, audience, and products, delivering the trading drumbeat and creating data solutions for the team. This role will support optimisation of the entire shopper funnel, and in conjunction with the wider A&I Team, enable marketing and operational strategies to ultimately drive commercial results.

Ultimately, the A&I partner uncovers unexpected insights to help The LEGO Group reach more consumers.

Do you have what it takes?

The requirements to succeed in this role are the following



  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience in the data industry
  • Ability to influence the course of business through sharp analysis, effective communication and strong business acumen; identifying commercial opportunities
  • Proficiency in managing a mix of datasets from different sources to analyse commercial performance
  • Strong analytical skills, robust commercial acumen and strength in deriving commercially valuable insights from data
  • Expertise in managing analytics tools and Data Query coding (e.g.,SQL, Python)
  • Business Intelligence & Reporting Tools (e.g., Power BI)
  • Good awareness of common Data Analytics techniques, together with advanced Data Visualisation Skills
  • Strong communications and presentation skills – able to communicate complex data analysis to a non-technical audience in a simple way
  • Strong collaboration skills
  • Fluency to work in English



Moreover, it would be an advantage if you demonstrate



  • Experience with Data Science and Advanced Analytics Techniques (Exploratory Data Analysis, Classification, Regression, Clustering)
  • Experience of the Amazon ecosystem, including Amazon Platform, Data, and Tools (i.e., Retail Platform, Amazon Advertising Platform, Amazon Marketing Cloud)
  • Experience working in the Consumer Good industry and/or in eCommerce



Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. For all candidates, if you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Salesforce/ Data Analyst – Ecommerce | Hybrid (2-3 days in London office)







A well-recognised leading technology company based in London is seeking a Data Analyst to join its Business Intelligence (BI) team. The BI team plays a crucial role in providing advanced analytics, data modelling, and cutting-edge data visualisation to generate strategic insights that drive business decisions.




This is an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic, engaging, and collaborative environment alongside a fantastic team.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop actionable insights and communicate key learnings to global business stakeholders.
Perform data maintenance, process reviews, and data quality checks across CRM systems (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud) and external data sources.
Develop and maintain business projection models to inform senior stakeholders.
Review existing data journeys and ensure data integrity across platforms (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud).
Maintain and support the creation of new data sources and data visualisations (Tableau).
Support the team with regular data transfers and uploads when required.
Promote data-driven decision-making across key business stakeholders.

Key Requirements:

2+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst with a strong business analytics background.
Proficiency in Salesfoce
Knowledge of SQL and/or SOQL.
Experience using Tableau (or similar data visualisation tools).
Background in CRM marketing or data management (preferable).
Strong working knowledge of Excel.

What We Offer:

Flexible working (hybrid model – 2-3 days in London office).
Competitive salary & benefits package.




A fantastic opportunity to work in a collaborative and innovative environment.

For more information, please contact info@freshtechit.com.

Title: Data Analyst (AI Startup)
Description:
The basics


Your title will be Data Analyst
This role pays £50k-£80k/year + equity
Matt, Cofounder and CTO, is the hiring manager
We work Mon-Thu in our office in Chancery Lane, London


What are we building? An AI Executive Assistant

In 1930, the economist John Maynard Keynes predicted that we'd only be working 15 hours a week by 2030. Despite automation in agriculture and industry, that hasn't happened.

Why? The service sector. Walk around the average office and you'll see people's days taken up by emails, Slack and meetings instead of real work.

People in client facing roles - sales, professional services firms, recruiters - feel this most acutely. Instead of advising clients, they spend hours on admin. Following up. Scheduling meetings and taking notes on them. Answering repetitive questions over email.

We've built an AI executive assistant that looks at your emails, messages and meetings, and uses that knowledge to answer your email, schedule meetings, take next steps from meetings and organise your inbox.

Unlike other startups, we're a pure-play applied AI company, not a SaaS company with AI features hastily bolted on! We make use of the best techniques (fine tuned open source models, tool use, and retrieval augmented generation) and as a result, users send 53% of the email drafts we generate.

How has it been going?

Since launching in March 2024, we've gone from $0 to $2.5m in revenue across 3000 paid users. We did this with a team of 4, and without using any paid marketing until November.

We spent Q4 2024 in San Francisco at HF0, the best AI startup accelerator in the world, learning from experts like the CEO of Instacart, Head of Applied Research at OpenAI and the cofounder of Snowflake.

What do we value?

We're very intentional about adding new people. We think a small team of exceptional people working hard at a problem they care about will always beat a larger, more unfocused team. That means you'll need to bring an intensity to this role that might not be asked at other companies. But it also means you will be fast tracked into more senior roles and responsibilities far earlier.

We also believe in hiring people who want ownership and autonomy in their work, and giving it to them. Instead of just being handed tickets, you'll be proactively suggesting metrics that should be monitored and one off analyses that should be done, and proposing improvements to our analytics infrastructure.

What will I do?


Running analyses in SQL to make decisions on product, marketing spend, and pricing strategy, and communicating your findings, method, and recommendations in a clear way to both technical and non-technical audiences
Working with stakeholders in the marketing, sales, customer success and product departments to agree metrics that need to be monitored on an ongoing basis, then building visualisations
Working with data engineers to ensure data is modelled in the correct format to support data visualisation and more detailed analyses


What does our ideal hire look like?

You've worked at an early stage tech company (<100 people) as a data analyst or similar
You have an expert level understanding of both SQL and a data visualization tool (we use Metabase). If you don't know SQL to a very high standard, you shouldn't apply
You are excellent at communicating your analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences: the results, your recommendations, and the method you used
You can proactively structure an analysis given only a business problem
Urgency and intensity in your work


Our tech stack

Broadly, we use a fairly typical ELT stack. It's not a requirement to have worked with every tool we use, but the more the better!


BigQuery as our data warehouse
Metabase for data visualization
Fivetran to pipe raw data from third party tools (eg Stripe, which we use for billing) into our data warehouse
dbt hosted on Github Actions for transformation of raw data into production tables ready for consumption
Census for reverse ETL


The application process


Submit your CV (no need for a cover letter)
An initial call with someone from the Fyxer AI team to review your experience and motivation for joining (15 mins)
Live coding exercise - SQL (30 minutes)
Analytical case study (45 minutes)
Meet Richard - CEO (30 minutes)

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
About the role

As part of the HR Systems team, you will join the wider HR function to provide support to the business globally.




In this role you will be able to generate reports that will support decision making across the business and improve workflow across all functions.

You will identify critical gaps in data management, process optimization, and cross-regional administrative support within the HR function.




This is an important role for the wider HR function as it will enhance operational efficiency and free capacity for the team to focus on strategic priorities.




Requirements

For this role, you will have:

• A university degree with 2-5 years relevant experience

• Strong HR administration and technical capability

• Experience with data analysis, and utilizing data analysis tools such as SQL or SSRS

• Familiarity with HRIS/HRMS and other HR business intelligence tools (Power BI preferred).

• Effective communication and interpersonal skills, facilitating stakeholder engagement across multiple levels.

• Organizational and project management expertise, with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks.

• Commitment to confidentiality, security, and adherence to data privacy regulations.

• Strong Microsoft Office skills with advanced ability in Excel is a must




Required Skills:

• Analytical Skills

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

• Excellent communication skills

• Excellent organizational skills

• Excellent interpersonal skills

• Attention to detail







Why Harneys?

Harneys is a global offshore law firm with entrepreneurial thinking built around professionalism, personal service and rapid response. Open, progressive and personable, we provide advice on British Virgin Islands, Cayman Islands, Cyprus, Bermuda and Anguilla law to an international client base which includes the world’s top law firms, financial institutions, investment funds and private individuals. Our network is the largest among offshore law firms, with locations in major financial centres across Europe, Asia, the Americas and the Caribbean, allowing us to provide services of the highest quality to clients in their own languages and time zones.

Harneys is strictly an equal opportunities employer and we recognise the benefits of diversity.




Led by a senior team of experienced offshore lawyers and located in the heart of one of the world's largest financial centres, Harneys London opened in 2002 and services a strong base of clients in the UK and throughout Europe. The firm’s London lawyers provide a full range of offerings across all practice areas and specialisms.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Risk & Fraud




Location: Remote (London Rate)

Fixed-Term Contract (Initially 6 Months)




Experience Level: Mid-Senior (approx. 5-7 years)

Approx. £104,000 (Plus Benefits)




Job Overview




We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualization, Python, and risk & fraud analytics. The ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of experience in leveraging data-driven insights to detect fraud, assess risks, and enhance decision-making processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, providing analytical support and developing models to identify patterns of fraudulent activity.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyse large datasets to detect fraud patterns, anomalies, and risk trends.
Develop and maintain SQL queries, dashboards, and reports to support fraud detection and risk assessment.
Create data visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to communicate insights effectively.
Use Python for data manipulation, automation, and building fraud detection models.
Collaborate with risk, compliance, and engineering teams to enhance fraud mitigation strategies.
Monitor transaction data and develop predictive models to proactively identify potential fraud cases.
Provide actionable insights through exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling.
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and compliance with industry regulations.




Required Qualifications & Skills




5-7 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in risk, fraud, or financial services.
Strong SQL skills for querying and analyzing large datasets.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, or equivalent).
Hands-on experience with Python for data analysis and automation.
Familiarity with fraud detection techniques, risk scoring, and anomaly detection.
Experience working with large-scale transactional data and real-time fraud analytics.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to interpret complex data patterns.
Excellent communication skills to present insights to stakeholders.




Preferred Qualifications




Experience with machine learning models for fraud detection.
Knowledge of regulatory compliance in fraud prevention.
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop) is a plus.
Background in finance, banking, or e-commerce fraud analytics.




Why Join Us?




Work on impactful projects that combat fraud and enhance risk management.

Collaborative and dynamic work environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your Responsibilities

Our People Solutions team are looking for bright, enthusiastic and articulate candidates keen to gain experience and start their career in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Drive and attention to detail essential.

The successful candidates will be working closely with other analysts to learn the role and to support on the day-to-day needs.

You will be provided with structured and ‘on-the-job’ training, support with professional qualifications.


Manage, cleanse, and interpret internal data as well as client data.
Responsible for monthly uploads of claims and membership data.
Develop internal models.
Develop PowerBI dashboards for internal and external purposes.
Deliver claims forecasts on PMI and assist the actuarial team.
Carry out ad-hoc projects, across all lines of business, to support the business where possible.
Internal ‘go-to’ for excel support, client and internal ad-hoc requests.
Responsible for financial reporting for the People Solutions Executive Team


Qualifications


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Strong interest in programming languages such as DAX/VBA, R/Python
Strong problem-solving skills
Thorough and great attention to detail
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Interest in the healthcare and risk market

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Eviden, part of the Atos Group, with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion is a global leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 47,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.

The Opportunity


The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning team blend statistical techniques and ML to create value from data for our clients.
You will collaborate with business stakeholders to identify use cases and shape opportunities for delivering data science solutions, ensuring a clear connection to business benefits.
You'll extract, analyse, and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources, using algorithmic, data mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning and statistical tools, to make it accessible to our clients. You will then present your results using clear and engaging language in a way that bridges the fundamentally theoretical aspects of these initiatives to the business needs. This includes translating between technical and nontechnical audiences.
You will work across industries and technology platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) working with structured and unstructured data from an array of data sources.



 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities


Lead and deliver innovative technical solutions that will meet the requirements of our clients. This will entail gathering requirements, analysing, developing, testing, evaluating, and deploying the appropriate solution through the full development lifecycle.
Maintain clear and coherent communication, both verbal and written, to understand data needs and report results to technical and non-technical audiences.
Horizon scan to stay up to date with the latest technology, techniques, and methods.
Conduct research from which you'll develop prototypes and proof of concepts.
Manage and mentor junior team members.



 

Person Specification


Extensive experience in comprehending business challenges and converting this understanding into practical data science solutions.
Previous experience of delivering data science solutions using Microsoft Fabric and Azure DevOps or similar.
Passionate about the transformative impact the right information can have on a business.
Strong grasp of statistical methods, experimental design and the underlying principles of machine learning algorithms.
Ability to transform, analyse and model data from a variety of data sources, extracting and interpreting trends and insights.
Able to evaluate the models and experience of implementing them as stand-alone apps and as part of enterprise technology stacks. DataOps / MLOps experience would be valued.
Strong Python programming for modelling and/or data analysis is essential, preferably with experience using the spaCy NLP framework and BERT.
Knowledge of database design as well as strong experience with SQL queries is desirable. Familiarity with R and other common languages and tools would be beneficial.
Proficiency in stakeholder management and an effective, persuasive communication style to explain technical subjects to non-technical audiences.
Background in Mathematics or Physics and experience working within Agile projects as a team member and Scrum Master.



Eligibility Nice to have SC clearance or individuals with Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) who have been residing in the UK for the last 5 years are eligible to apply. Willing to travel if needed for client location (London).

We Care About Our Employees' Happiness By


25 days of Annual leave + an option to purchase more through our Flexible Benefits.
Flex benefits system – an exciting opportunity to choose your own benefits.
Retail discounts.
Pension - matching contribution up to 10%.
Private Medical Scheme.
Life Assurance.
Enrolment in our Share scheme - subject to scheme eligibility criteria.
Unlimited opportunities to learn in our Training platforms.



As a Disability Confident employer, we aim to ensure that people with disabilities who meet the minimum criteria for this position will be offered an interview. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments and changes as needed to the application and assessment process to remove or reduce any disadvantage associated with a person's disability.

Let’s grow together.
Show more

The Opportunity

  • The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning team blend statistical techniques and ML to create value from data for our clients.
  • You will collaborate with business stakeholders to identify use cases and shape opportunities for delivering data science solutions, ensuring a clear connection to business benefits.
  • You'll extract, analyse, and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources, using algorithmic, data mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning and statistical tools, to make it accessible to our clients. You will then present your results using clear and engaging language in a way that bridges the fundamentally theoretical aspects of these initiatives to the business needs. This includes translating between technical and nontechnical audiences.
  • You will work across industries and technology platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) working with structured and unstructured data from an array of data sources.


 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Lead and deliver innovative technical solutions that will meet the requirements of our clients. This will entail gathering requirements, analysing, developing, testing, evaluating, and deploying the appropriate solution through the full development lifecycle.
  • Maintain clear and coherent communication, both verbal and written, to understand data needs and report results to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Horizon scan to stay up to date with the latest technology, techniques, and methods.
  • Conduct research from which you'll develop prototypes and proof of concepts.
  • Manage and mentor junior team members.


 

Person Specification

  • Extensive experience in comprehending business challenges and converting this understanding into practical data science solutions.
  • Previous experience of delivering data science solutions using Microsoft Fabric and Azure DevOps or similar.
  • Passionate about the transformative impact the right information can have on a business.
  • Strong grasp of statistical methods, experimental design and the underlying principles of machine learning algorithms.
  • Ability to transform, analyse and model data from a variety of data sources, extracting and interpreting trends and insights.
  • Able to evaluate the models and experience of implementing them as stand-alone apps and as part of enterprise technology stacks. DataOps / MLOps experience would be valued.
  • Strong Python programming for modelling and/or data analysis is essential, preferably with experience using the spaCy NLP framework and BERT.
  • Knowledge of database design as well as strong experience with SQL queries is desirable. Familiarity with R and other common languages and tools would be beneficial.
  • Proficiency in stakeholder management and an effective, persuasive communication style to explain technical subjects to non-technical audiences.
  • Background in Mathematics or Physics and experience working within Agile projects as a team member and Scrum Master.


Eligibility Nice to have SC clearance or individuals with Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) who have been residing in the UK for the last 5 years are eligible to apply. Willing to travel if needed for client location (London).

We Care About Our Employees' Happiness By

  • 25 days of Annual leave + an option to purchase more through our Flexible Benefits.
  • Flex benefits system – an exciting opportunity to choose your own benefits.
  • Retail discounts.
  • Pension - matching contribution up to 10%.
  • Private Medical Scheme.
  • Life Assurance.
  • Enrolment in our Share scheme - subject to scheme eligibility criteria.
  • Unlimited opportunities to learn in our Training platforms.


As a Disability Confident employer, we aim to ensure that people with disabilities who meet the minimum criteria for this position will be offered an interview. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments and changes as needed to the application and assessment process to remove or reduce any disadvantage associated with a person's disability.

Let’s grow together.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Vinterior

Vinterior is the UK’s leading marketplace for premium pre-owned furniture, offering a sustainable alternative to brand-new.

Since 2016, we’ve built Europe’s largest collection of pre-loved pieces, spanning 25 styles and 100 categories, driving a circular economy for furniture. With 14,000 sellers and 400,000+ unique items, Vinterior is the #1 destination for preloved furniture and homeware in the UK.

Backed by top investors like Seedcamp, Venrex, Active Partners, and Channel 4 Ventures, we’ve raised £16 million to date. This funding will fuel our expansion as we aim to become Europe’s leading pre-owned furniture platform within three years.

About The Role

The objective of the role is to uncover insights that will help Vinterior find and prioritise the best opportunities to grow GMV (gross merchandise value, the total value of sales made on our platform) and revenues (Vinterior’s revenue from commission, fees and other sources), and to evaluate tests and initiatives that are launched to make the best decisions about them.

You’ll run your own analysis projects but also keep our analytical tools working well, supporting the wider team in running their own analyses and expanding our data models as the business changes.

This role reports directly to the Chief Product and Technology Officer, but day-to-day will work with all functions in the business: product, supply, brand, CX and finance.

This role is remote, preferably in the UK but Europe on UK timezones works too. Some travel to London and/or other European cities will be required for offsites, once or twice a year.

Core Responsibilities:

The key responsibility of the role is to use data analysis to uncover and evaluate growth opportunities for Vinterior, while helping the wider team use our data tooling for their own analyses.


Customer and commercial insights
Further Vinterior's understanding of its customers and generate growth hypotheses from this understanding, using customer surveys, feedback tools and qualitative methods in addition to data analysis
Conduct regular analysis of the inventory on Vinterior and what type of inventory is driving sales
Analyse opportunities to grow revenues


Product analysis


Support the Senior Product Manager with analysis to inform product strategy and feature development
Conduct deep-dive analysis on the results of product tests and exepriments, and website changes, to understand their impact and share these results with the wider team


Data and BI management


Manage and maintain our Looker instance, adding new data models as
Support and train the wider team to run their own analyses using Looker, Looker Studio, Amplitude and other tools


User acquisition and retention analysis


Analyse the effectiveness of user acquisition activity (marketing channels)
Help the business understand repeat purchase behaviour and customer lifetime value, making recommendations on how to improve it


Strategic expansion opportunities


Perform analysis to evaluate opportunities such as international or category expansion.


Requirements

Qualifications:


You have at least 2+ years experience in an analyst role, in house at a digital and consumer focused company or with a consulting firm, ideally with a business growth focus


Who you are:


You are customer-focussed in your thinking and have a deep natural curiosity for how customers think and behave
You're exceptionally numerate and analytical; you have a strong academic record in maths and can demonstrate your skill across the full scope of analytical projects: defining objectives, designing and structuring analysis, methodology selection and execution, interpreting and communicating results
You have advanced skills in excel/sheets, comfortable using BI tools (e.g. Looker) and web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Amplitude)
You have strong coding skills for data analysis – SQL for analysis essential, Python desirable
You have experience and aptitude in survey design and qualitative analysis in addition to quantitative data analysis
You're excited about an independent analyst role with a broad scope, and passionate about helping Vinterior grow its business


Benefits

Why join us?

Work directly with the leadership team of a high-growth, mission-driven startup.

Be a part of something impactful: championing sustainability and shaping the future of furniture resale

Grow with us: This role offers unmatched learning opportunities in a fast-paced environment, with hands-on exposure to all areas of business. You’ll have access to mentorship from experienced executives and the opportunity to shape your role as the company grows.

Inclusive culture: We welcome diverse perspectives and celebrate the uniqueness of our team members

Benefits:


Annual Leave: 25 days of paid leave in addition to 8 bank holidays
Tenure Gift: You will receive additional paid leave for 1+ years of service to the company.
Private Medical Insurance: Comprehensive private medical insurance coverage to ensure your well-being (dependent on role/contract)
Co-working Allowance: A monthly allowance of £150 for co-working and office space access (dependent on role/contract)
Health and Well-being Allowance: A monthly allowance of £50 for health and well-being expenses (dependent on role/contract)
ThanksBen Flexible Benefits Platform: Our flexible benefits platform offers various options, including a pension scheme. The employer contribution is 3% of your salary, while the employee contribution is 5%. We use NEST as a Pension provider (dependent onrole/contract)
Charity Days: You will receive paid leave to support your chosen charity and make a positive impact on the community.
Employee Vinterior Discount: Enjoy a special discount on Vinterior products as an employee of Vinterior.


Please note that all benefits are subject to the terms and conditions outlined in our employee handbook.

Our Company Values:

Our interview process looks for people who share our company values.

If these principles resonate with you and describe the kinds of people you would like to work with, then you are likely to enjoy and thrive in the working culture at Vinterior

Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion

At Vinterior, we believe that diversity is our strength. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and are committed to providing a fair and inclusive hiring process. If you don’t meet every requirement but are passionate about our mission, we encourage you to apply. Let us know if you need any adjustments during the application process to support your application.

Ready to apply?

InInterested in helping us shape the future of furniture? Apply now by submitting your CV and a short cover letter outlining why you’re excited about this role and what you can bring to Vinterior.

No recruitment consultants please. Visa Sponsorship not available.

Our hiring process


Initial Screening – You'll start with a conversation with our CPTO or COS to learn more about your experience and ensure a strong fit with our team.
Case Study – You’ll complete a case study to showcase your analytical and SQL skills and present your solutions to our CPTO.
Culture fit interview – You'll meet with our team to dive deeper into your culture fit.
CEO & Founder Meeting – A one-on-one meeting with our CEO and Founder to discuss your vision and alignment with our mission.


We aim to move swiftly and ensure a smooth, engaging process throughout.

Title: Data Analyst - Subscriptions
Description:
Data Analyst - Subscriptions & Analytics - Power BI




Location: Central London




Compensation: £50,000 - £70,000 + Benefits




Type: Permanent




Are you ready to propel your career to new heights with a dynamic digital company who are truly value driven ? We're on the hunt for a talented Data Analyst who boasts a solid background in subscriptions and audience insights. If you're adept with Power BI and have a passion for turning data into actionable intelligence, we want to hear from you!




What You’ll Do:




Join a vibrant team where you’ll play a pivotal role in enhancing our subscriptions business. Your responsibilities will span a diverse range of tasks in an agile, fast-paced environment:




Harness data analysis to drive subscription growth initiatives.
Design and implement sophisticated data models for seamless automated reporting.
Analyze and refine audience segments to tailor our offerings.
Create engaging and insightful Power BI reports, while continually enhancing existing ones.
Ensure the integrity and flow of data and analytics within our systems.
Collaborate with product and audience stakeholders to refine data needs and insights.




Key Qualifications:




Proven experience in data and audience analytics, particularly in Power BI development.
Proficient in Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, or similar tools.
Strong familiarity with marketing metrics and data from social media platforms.
Expertise in Power BI, including DAX and M for effective data modelling and visualization.
Competent in connecting to both SQL and non-SQL data sources.
Detail-oriented approach with a robust command of SQL for conducting data quality assessments and ad hoc analyses.
Understanding of data migration, ETL processes, and relational data structures.
Excellent communication skills, characterized by confidence and proactivity.
A data-driven mindset with the ability to conceptualize the end-to-end data process.
A degree in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, science, or computer science is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

LGC is a global life science tools company with a broad portfolio. We work closely with our diverse customers to drive science forward and find solutions that diagnose, heal, and help feed our growing population.

Our 180 years of scientific heritage, combined with a track record of innovation and value-enhancing acquisitions, has enabled us to build our product portfolio and expertise, and develop deep relationships with customers, industry partners and the global scientific community.

The National Institute for Health and Care Research (NIHR) is funded by the Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC). We work in partnership with the NHS, universities, local government, other research funders, patients and the public.

Job Description

The NIHR is looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst with expertise in SQL, Qlik, Alteryx, and other analytical tools to join our dynamic Data Analytics team. This role offers an exciting opportunity to play a key part in data-driven decision-making, collaborating across multiple business areas to deliver meaningful insights that drive impact.

The Data and Insights team provides analytical support to internal teams and external customers. As a member of this team, reporting to the Data Analytics Manager, you will be interacting with all areas of the business, providing ad-hoc and routine analytical support. Working with the other data analysts and data engineer you will help to maintain existing databases and Qlik applications and produce new applications as and when there is a business need. You will have interactions with other areas of NIHR, including helping to answer information requests, freedom of information requests, and dealing with stakeholders in the Department of Health and Social Care.

Key Responsibilities:


Respond to requests for information under tight KPIs from internal and external stakeholders
Provide analytical support for quarterly and annual reports
Generate high quality visualisations to be used in reports for stakeholders
Undertake any ad hoc analyses tasks or projects as required
Contributing to the creation of dashboards (Qlik)
Develop workflows via Alteryx to automate and improve existing processes
Manage and maintain large, complex datasets primarily through SQL Server Management Studio
Support in the development of existing and new data products and services
Innovate and improve our existing SQL setup through self-driven initiatives
Managing SQL jobs and Stored procedures (building and deploying)
Troubleshoot database-related application performance issues as they arise
Study work methods and improve procedures to increase efficiency of data collection and analysis.
Assist with implementing quality assurance processes to ensure data collected and reports are of a high standard.
Liaise with and maintain good working relationships with internal teams and external stakeholder
Creation and review of documentation and work procedures.


Qualifications

Experience, Qualifications and Skills

Required Criteria


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification
2+ years of experience in a similar analyst role
Advanced proficiency in Alteryx, including building complex workflows, utilizing macros, and integrating APIs
Hands-on experience with Business Intelligence and Data Visualization tools (Qlik preferred)


Desired Criteria


Previous experience or a strong interest in clinical research.
Familiar with various file-managements systems such as MS Sharepoint and Google Drive.
Knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Knowledge of SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
Knowledge of Business Intelligence/Data Visualisation software (Qlik preferable)
Knowledge of cloud hosted database environments such as Amazon Web Services


Key Competencies


Excellent verbal and written communication skills; being able to know when to interact formally or informally.
Meticulous attention to detail.
Ability to work to tight deadlines and to prioritise a diverse workload.
Good organisational skills, including detailed record keeping.
High level of proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, but with expert proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Committed team player with a positive attitude and an ability to build effective working relationships.


Role Dimensions


Teamwork
Responsibility
Motivation
Organisation
Communication
Problem Solving


Additional Information

Salary & Benefits

£39,200 per year

Bonus - subject to company performance

25 days annual leave, plus public holidays (UK)

Enhanced contributory pension scheme

Life Insurance

Benenden Healthcare

Season Ticket Loan

Note: This is a full-time, permanent, hybrid role. Employees are required to work from our Twickenham office at least one day per week, with the possibility of increased office attendance based on team needs.

Application

If you are excited about the prospect of joining our team and believe you possess the relevant skills and background, we invite you to apply. Please submit your CV along with a 'Statement of Suitability' that showcases your key skills and experiences in relation to the 'Required Criteria' outlined in the job description. Additionally, share your enthusiasm for working with the LGC Group.

Note: The application deadline is 5 PM on 21st February, with interviews scheduled to take place from 26th February onwards.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES

LGC strongly believes that every job applicant and employee should be valued for their individual talents regardless of age, disability, race, colour, ethnic or national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marital or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Short listing, interviewing and selection will always be carried out without regard to gender, sexual orientation, marital status, colour, race, nationality, ethnic or national origins, religion or belief, age, or trade union membership.

For more information about LGC, please visit our website www.lgcgroup.com
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

LGC is a global life science tools company with a broad portfolio. We work closely with our diverse customers to drive science forward and find solutions that diagnose, heal, and help feed our growing population.

Our 180 years of scientific heritage, combined with a track record of innovation and value-enhancing acquisitions, has enabled us to build our product portfolio and expertise, and develop deep relationships with customers, industry partners and the global scientific community.

The National Institute for Health and Care Research (NIHR) is funded by the Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC). We work in partnership with the NHS, universities, local government, other research funders, patients and the public.

Job Description

The NIHR is looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst with expertise in SQL, Qlik, Alteryx, and other analytical tools to join our dynamic Data Analytics team. This role offers an exciting opportunity to play a key part in data-driven decision-making, collaborating across multiple business areas to deliver meaningful insights that drive impact.

The Data and Insights team provides analytical support to internal teams and external customers. As a member of this team, reporting to the Data Analytics Manager, you will be interacting with all areas of the business, providing ad-hoc and routine analytical support. Working with the other data analysts and data engineer you will help to maintain existing databases and Qlik applications and produce new applications as and when there is a business need. You will have interactions with other areas of NIHR, including helping to answer information requests, freedom of information requests, and dealing with stakeholders in the Department of Health and Social Care.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Respond to requests for information under tight KPIs from internal and external stakeholders
  • Provide analytical support for quarterly and annual reports
  • Generate high quality visualisations to be used in reports for stakeholders
  • Undertake any ad hoc analyses tasks or projects as required
  • Contributing to the creation of dashboards (Qlik)
  • Develop workflows via Alteryx to automate and improve existing processes
  • Manage and maintain large, complex datasets primarily through SQL Server Management Studio
  • Support in the development of existing and new data products and services
  • Innovate and improve our existing SQL setup through self-driven initiatives
  • Managing SQL jobs and Stored procedures (building and deploying)
  • Troubleshoot database-related application performance issues as they arise
  • Study work methods and improve procedures to increase efficiency of data collection and analysis.
  • Assist with implementing quality assurance processes to ensure data collected and reports are of a high standard.
  • Liaise with and maintain good working relationships with internal teams and external stakeholder
  • Creation and review of documentation and work procedures.

Qualifications

Experience, Qualifications and Skills

Required Criteria

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification
  • 2+ years of experience in a similar analyst role
  • Advanced proficiency in Alteryx, including building complex workflows, utilizing macros, and integrating APIs
  • Hands-on experience with Business Intelligence and Data Visualization tools (Qlik preferred)

Desired Criteria

  • Previous experience or a strong interest in clinical research.
  • Familiar with various file-managements systems such as MS Sharepoint and Google Drive.
  • Knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
  • Knowledge of SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
  • Knowledge of Business Intelligence/Data Visualisation software (Qlik preferable)
  • Knowledge of cloud hosted database environments such as Amazon Web Services

Key Competencies

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; being able to know when to interact formally or informally.
  • Meticulous attention to detail.
  • Ability to work to tight deadlines and to prioritise a diverse workload.
  • Good organisational skills, including detailed record keeping.
  • High level of proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, but with expert proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
  • Committed team player with a positive attitude and an ability to build effective working relationships.

Role Dimensions

  • Teamwork
  • Responsibility
  • Motivation
  • Organisation
  • Communication
  • Problem Solving

Additional Information

Salary & Benefits

£39,200 per year

Bonus - subject to company performance

25 days annual leave, plus public holidays (UK)

Enhanced contributory pension scheme

Life Insurance

Benenden Healthcare

Season Ticket Loan

Note: This is a full-time, permanent, hybrid role. Employees are required to work from our Twickenham office at least one day per week, with the possibility of increased office attendance based on team needs.

Application

If you are excited about the prospect of joining our team and believe you possess the relevant skills and background, we invite you to apply. Please submit your CV along with a 'Statement of Suitability' that showcases your key skills and experiences in relation to the 'Required Criteria' outlined in the job description. Additionally, share your enthusiasm for working with the LGC Group.

Note: The application deadline is 5 PM on 21st February, with interviews scheduled to take place from 26th February onwards.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES

LGC strongly believes that every job applicant and employee should be valued for their individual talents regardless of age, disability, race, colour, ethnic or national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marital or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Short listing, interviewing and selection will always be carried out without regard to gender, sexual orientation, marital status, colour, race, nationality, ethnic or national origins, religion or belief, age, or trade union membership.

For more information about LGC, please visit our website www.lgcgroup.com

Title: Data Analyst - Excel
Description:
DATA ANALYST - EXCEL

£250-£300 PER DAY OUTSIDE IR35

LONDON (1/2 DAYS IN THE OFFICE)

6 MONTH CONTRACT

THE COMPANY:

Join a data-driven company as a Data Analyst and help drive their data initiatives.

THE ROLE:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a huge role in enhancing the company's operational efficiency by creating and maintaining complex Excel and Business Objects business intelligence reports.

Your responsibilities will include:

Developing advanced Excel spreadsheets, including macros and VBA programming.
Supporting ad hoc data analysis.
Automating existing processes and data pipelines in R and/or Python.
Improving data accuracy and quality.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements.
Troubleshooting and maintaining existing Excel reports.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Data Analyst will be required to have the following experience:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Advanced skills in Excel, R and/or Python.
Business Objects experience is a plus!
Strong communication skills.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Mojola Coker via the apply link on this page.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: SC Cleared Data Analyst

Location: London (Onsite 3 days per week)

Contract Type: 3-month contract with potential for extension

Rate: £400 per day (Inside IR35)

Role Overview

We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst to join our team in a client-facing, data-driven role. The successful candidate will work on an AWS infrastructure-based data platform, focusing on reviewing, correcting, and separating inaccurate or merged data. This role involves working with confidential information and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and integrity.

Key Responsibilities

Data Integrity: Review and correct inaccurate identities across various systems to ensure accurate data representation.
Workload Management: Independently manage workloads to meet deadlines while balancing conflicting priorities.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders to deliver high-quality results.
Analytical Thinking: Objectively assess complex information from multiple sources to draw meaningful conclusions.
Technical Application: Utilise Python scripting, Atlassian toolsets and other technologies to perform data corrections and analysis.
Confidentiality: Handle sensitive and confidential information in a secure and professional manner.

Required Skills and Experience

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret and process complex datasets.
Proficiency in Python scripting for automation and data manipulation.
Familiarity with AWS infrastructure and related tools.
Experience working with sensitive data in compliance with regulations.
Excellent communication skills for engaging with clients and stakeholders.
Ability to adapt quickly to changing circumstances and prioritise tasks effectively.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with Simply Business helping them to hire the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.




Simply Business is an online business insurance brokerage that specialises in one thing: protecting the businesses their customers are working hard to build. Since they started life in 2005, they have helped over three million small businesses and self-employed people find the protection that’s right for them, from builders to bakers and personal trainers. Their big idea was to reduce time, hassle and jargon wherever possible, while introducing the simplicity, choice and value that they believe small businesses and landlords are entitled to.




Their story - continued commitment to doing the right thing




2005 seems like a long time ago. Simply Business – a small company with a big idea. To transform the way that other small businesses could get the insurance that they need. To reduce time, hassle and jargon wherever possible while introducing the simplicity, choice and value that small businesses are entitled to. To protect them from harm. To keep their livelihoods safe. And to do all this with the promise of positive service. Delivered by happy people, working flexibly, learning constantly. With a restlessly innovative spirit. Within a business committed to doing the right thing. All of the time.




As they've grown, they've tried hard to keep true to this. To ourselves, to their 800 strong team and to the 3.5m customers that they've served so far. And as they move forward, as they enter a big new market, as they grow responsibly, as they improve their products, as they offer their customers more of what they need, of what they deserve, they'll hold onto the focus of that small company with the big idea. Protecting and serving businesses across the UK and the US. From barbers to bakers, consultants to cleaners, they are the backbone of the economy.




And they'll continue to stand by them. Bit by bit helping their dreams grow, just like ours.




Why do they need this role?




This role will sit within the global Data and Analytics team (DNA) in Simply Business. DNA has been central to empowering data-driven decision making at SB. They have invested heavily in their data pipeline, data engineering and their business intelligence capabilities.
In 2023 and beyond, they will continue investing a significant amount of effort in ramping up their Business Intelligence capabilities to drive business decisions.
The primary duty of this role will be to provide analytical support for their business stakeholders. This includes leading the measurement and evaluation of their product value streams and ensuring that they continuously improve the effectiveness of their product investments. Success in this role will require you to be a trusted advisor to their business partners, ensuring they focus their efforts on the most value-added insights initiatives.




In this role, you will:




Create data models in their Snowflake data warehouse
Integrate new sources of data to enrich their analytical capabilities
Work with the engineering and product teams to ensure application design accommodates reporting and analytics requirements
Work with various business and engineering teams to ensure reliable, scalable, robust architecture for their analytics platform and ETL pipelines
Partner with stakeholders to identify business use cases and translate them into the right analytical problem that you will build, test and productionize
Particular focus will be on use cases that will help them drive operational efficiencies as the organization scales.
Increase the organization's ability to convert more customers.
Clearly communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences
Contribute to longer term strategic DNA projects




What are they looking for:




At least 3 years of overall experience in data & analytics, operational analytics experience is desired;
Degree with analytics or software engineering experience or equivalent work experience;
Experience with cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake or similar;
Experience designing and creating SQL data models using dbt (dbt Certification a plus);
Strong communication and data presentation skills through the use of effective data visualisation and BI tools, e.g. Looker, Tableau, Power BI, etc;
Effective at building strong, influential relationships with colleagues and partners, with demonstrated success in delivering impactful insights to executives;
Self-starter who is comfortable working in a globally distributed team environment
Experience in Python or another programming language (e.g. Kotlin, Scala, Ruby) is welcomed

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Epsom (Hybrid)

Job Type: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Competitive

Benefits: Excellent package

Are you looking for an opportunity to work with one of Surrey's most prestigious organisations? Our innovative and market-leading client is seeking a talented Business Data Analyst to join their team. This is a fantastic chance to leverage Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Services to drive key insights and influence strategic decision-making across the organisation.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with stakeholders to understand business challenges and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Analyze, interpret, and present insights using tools such as Excel, Power BI, and Cognos.
Collaborate with data engineers and BI developers to deliver high-quality reports and dashboards.
Challenge and refine business requirements to ensure optimal outcomes.
Identify opportunities to enhance processes and efficiency through BI solutions.
Support pipeline reporting and maintain data documentation for accuracy and consistency.


What We're Looking For


Proven experience in data analysis and business intelligence.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to present insights clearly and effectively.
Hands-on experience with BI tools and data visualisation platforms.
A proactive and analytical mindset, with a passion for continuous improvement.


Why Join Us?


A dynamic and fast-paced environment that fosters professional growth.
Opportunities to expand your expertise in BI tools, including IBM Cognos Suite.
Supportive leadership and a collaborative team culture.
Competitive salary and the opportunity to make a real impact.


Benefits Package


Hybrid working - minimum 2 days per week in the office.
On-site café, restaurant, and gym.
Employee perks through Reward Gateway (discount vouchers, offers, and more).
Access to a sports and social club.
On-site parking for convenience.
Private medical insurance (PMI) via Bupa, covering single, partner/spouse, and dependent children.
Income Protection Scheme and Life Assurance (10x salary).
Employee Car Scheme for additional savings.
Dress for Your Working Day policy for a relaxed and professional approach.


If you're a data-driven problem solver with a passion for BI and analytics, we'd love to hear from you!

Apply today and be part of a forward-thinking organisation that values innovation and excellence.

Please be aware this advert will remain open until the vacancy has been filled. Interviews will take place throughout this period, therefore we encourage you to apply early to avoid disappointment.

Tate is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

Tate is committed to promoting equal opportunities. To ensure that every candidate has the best experience with us, we encourage you to let us know if there are any adjustments we can make during the application or interview process. Your comfort and accessibility are our priority, and we are here to support you every step of the way. Additionally, we value and respect your individuality, and we invite you to share your preferred pronouns in your application.

Title: Data Analyst, UK
Description:
Description

About Reserv

Reserv is an insurtech creating and incubating cutting-edge AI and automation technology to bring efficiency and simplicity to claims. Founded by insurtech veterans with deep experience in SaaS and digital claims, Reserv is venture-backed by Bain Capital and Altai Ventures and began operations in May 2022. We are focused on automating highly manual tasks to tackle long-standing problems in claims and set a new standard for TPAs, insurance technology providers, and adjusters alike.

We have ambitious (but attainable!) goals and need people who can work in an evolving environment. If building a leading TPA and the prospect of tackling the long-standing challenges of the claims role sounds exciting, we can't wait to meet you.

About the role

As an analyst in a well-funded Series B stage start-up, you will be defining our growth potential for years to come. You will be an integral part of Reserv's data organization, working with our customers to deliver exemplary data management of their claims portfolios.

For this role, we are seeking an analytics professional with strong technical skills and the desire to learn and grow in their role. This role will require you to own day to day reporting and analyses for our customers, all the while automating away mundane and repetitive reporting, while building processes with the operations team that benefit our data asset.

What we need

We need you to do all the things typical to the role:


Work with our data stack: Python (Pandas to Langchain), Postgres, Looker, ECS, Docker etc.
Ship reporting code and operational processes that solve for our customers' needs.
Serve as the analyst responsible for our monthly reporting packages.
Liaise with our operations teams solving for nuanced data issues.
Communicate ideas and specifications through detailed, precise writing.
Influence the culture, values, and processes of a growing technology team.
Enjoy and have fun being creative and thinking outside of the box. You will need to draw on analogous situations you've worked on before, but we are not traversing well-traveled roads. "Where we're going, we don't need roads!"


Requirements


3-5 years of experience in a data science or analytics role, preferably within the insurance and/or claims space, with experience working independently / in a small team.
Have a proven track record of shipping high quality data analysis at a high cadence.
Experience using modern analytics and programming languages with an emphasis on statistical analysis.
A proven ability to manage relationships with high value customers and communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences alike.
The ability to wear adjacent hats as you grow your scope: analyst, developer, customer manager.
A passion for building intuitive technology and a thirst for learning.


Benefits


Generous health-insurance package
Pension plan with employer contributions
Competitive holiday / leave policy in addition to bank holidays – we want our employees fresh, healthy, happy, and energized!
Industry Qualifications paid by us (after a qualifying period)
Work from anywhere to facilitate your work-life balance
Apple laptop, large second monitor, and other quality-of-life equipment. Technology is something that should make your life easier, not harder!


At Reserv, we value diversity in backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences and believe that diversity in viewpoints and critical thinking drives innovation, first-principles thinking, and success. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and encourage those from all walks of life to apply. If you believe you are a good fit for this role, we would love to hear from you!
Show more

  • Apple laptop, large second monitor, and other quality-of-life equipment. Technology is something that should make your life easier, not harder!

At Reserv, we value diversity in backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences and believe that diversity in viewpoints and critical thinking drives innovation, first-principles thinking, and success. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and encourage those from all walks of life to apply. If you believe you are a good fit for this role, we would love to hear from you!

Title: Junior Analyst
Description:
We are looking for innovative, analytical thinkers to join our Gas Operations team. Are you looking to build the foundations of a strong, fast-paced career in the energy industry with a growing independent energy supplier?




What Will I Do?

As a Junior Operations Analyst you will be responsible for the analysis and interpretation of data from a variety of sources, identifying anomalies as appropriate. Working alongside internal stakeholders, and a number of third-parties you will support the resolution of customers’ queries, always ensuring customer data is up-to-date and accurately reflects our billing systems.




What Skills Do I Need?

This role would be ideally suited to someone who is highly numerate with a great eye for detail and is comfortable working with large datasets. Ideally you will already have a working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and be able to learn our internal database systems and processes.




What can we offer?

This role offers a competitive package of remuneration along with access to a wide range of company benefits which includes;

Private medical insurance, including 24/7 GP appointments and access to a wide range of professional support. We also offer a life assurance and income protection scheme from day one!
Our annual company profit share scheme, rewarding everyone at Corona by sharing in our success.
Employee self-sacrifice Electric Vehicle scheme, with a wide range of different models to choose from – supporting our commitment to the energy transition.
Access to thousands of retail and entertainment discounts through our internal rewards and recognition scheme, all linked to our company values.




On top of these great benefits, we also continue to invest in our people through a wealth of development opportunities, supporting you to get the most from your career!




Working Pattern

In this role you will be able to work on a hybrid pattern, with Tues-Thurs in the office and Monday and Friday at home. Our standard office hours are 0830 – 1700, Monday to Friday.




Working with us at Corona Energy

At Corona Energy we are driven by our company culture which is focused around our core values; Empowered, Forward Thinking and Impactful – these are underpinned by our central value “Customer First”. This year we were proud to have been independently certified as one of the Best Places to Work in the UK with over 80% of our team recognising our outstanding employee experience!




To support this experience, we also offer our team;

Amazing office spaces, with complimentary breakfast, fruit, snacks and drinks throughout the day.
An annual focus on wellbeing with events and activities to support your health, wealth and inner-self!
An opportunity to support our charity partners, or to give back to important causes by fundraising or volunteering our time.
The chance to celebrate success together, at one of our regular sports and social events or at our annual company awards.




If you are looking for a career that is all about positive energy, we would welcome your application!




Corona Energy is a Disability Confident employer and as such will offer any successful applicant whatever reasonable adjustments they may require in order to take part in our recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

6 Month contract – Inside IR35 – Up to £350 a day

Slough based – Hybrid Working – 2/3 days office based

Telecoms industry




About the Role:

This role sits in the central Analytics & Insight Chapter and supports our campaign to understand our customers and provide insights and actionable recommendations that help to achieve our business objectives

The position will require a solid understanding of SQL and technical skills, so that you are able to mine internal data and provide highly actionable insight to the business. Cleansing and maintenance of a set of analytics data views for onward use in insights, BI reporting and campaign performance measurement will be integral to the role.

You will work very closely with your squad's Value Lead and other stakeholders to understand their needs and objectives and then implement appropriate solutions. The role also requires close collaboration with fellow data analysts and a strong understanding of our business fundamentals.

You will be strong at relationship building and communication to ensure that briefs are stress tested to provide maximum value to customers. Presenting findings expertly and influencing stakeholders will also be a key focus.




Key Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst you will:

Receive and develop briefs from your Value Lead and work collaboratively to ensure work of the highest quality
Maintain analytics data views for accurate reporting and insights capability - Maintain and update stored procedures
Combine internal data with other data sources to provide a holistic view
Participate in all squad ceremonies and events, raising impediments as soon as identified to facilitate delivery
Inspect and adapt your way of working for continuous improvement
Embody an Agile mindset and culture to contribute to the growth in agile maturity of our business
Provide accurate, insightful and timely analysis to the business to help them make better decisions and enable the client to serve its customers a little better every day
Ability to simplify the complex and generate precise insights then communicate them clearly.
Continually look to improve processes through efficiencies and by applying best practice
Challenge the stakeholders and the business backlogs to focus work around the areas that really matter
Actively add to the Squads backlog with work that would benefit customers
Steer the agenda and be a trusted partner for work
Ability to contribute to an analytics roadmap for continuous insight delivery improvement




Skills & Experience Required:

Strong interpersonal skills so that you can work closely with the squads you support
Skilled at adapting communication for both technical and non-technical audiences
Able to learn data sources and methodologies quickly and apply technical skills to curate accurate analytics data views
Familiarity with GitHub and quality assurance checking of SQL scripts
Experience in obtaining insight from large data sets and sharing actionable learnings with the wider business
2 years+ experience in coding complex SQL queries against a large relational customer database, identifying relevant data sources and summarising to provide the insight as identified
Experience in updating SQL stored procedures
Ability to resolve data-related problems
Proficiency in Python and / or R a bonus
