Title: Customer Data Analyst - Sweaty Betty - (12-Month FTC)
Description:
Current employees, please apply in Workday.

As a Customer Data Analyst you'll turn complex data into growth opportunities, playing an instrumental role in shaping our customer strategy and tactical trading plans. By translating data into actionable insights, you'll empower our Marketing, Ecom and Product teams to develop data-driven, customer-centric strategies.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with internal teams to identify and prioritise key customer questions, conducting comprehensive analyses that inform strategic decisions aligned with customer needs and market trends
Analyse customer behaviour, product and transactional data on a weekly and monthly basis to provide actionable insights, identify trends and uncover tactical opportunities
Own the customer segmentation model, leveraging advanced analytics to predict customer behaviours, and lead customer-focused experimentation initiatives to uncover new opportunities
Confidently communicate insights to stakeholders at all levels by employing data storytelling techniques, ensuring that complex data is transformed into clear, engaging and actionable narratives
Proactively develop and improve PBI reports ensuring that complex analyses are understandable and actionable for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with the central data team to guarantee data accuracy across by conducting regular validations and deepening our understanding of data logics


Required Skills


Strong analytical skills in handling large, diverse datasets. Adept at identifying patterns, predicting trends, and providing comprehensive customer-focused solutions
Advanced proficiency in Excel, SQL and Power BI. Python is preferable
Highly numerate, with excellent written and verbal communication skills and meticulous attention to detail.
Ability to effectively plan and prioritise tasks in line with business requirements


Our DEI Commitment

We are working to create a culture and team that represents our mission of empowerment. We want to celebrate our diversity, embody inclusion and create an equitable business. This means doing more and working harder to make the long-lasting changes necessary. We care about our people, our community and world.

We want to stand up for what we believe in and give our people a platform to use their voice. To actively listen and learn from what they have to say. This involves focusing on learning, development, and progression across the business. Being clear on the responsibilities we hold each other and to our community. It also means being committed to equal employment opportunities. Ensuring we consider ALL applicants for jobs and working harder to make our job advertising more inclusive.

Our DEI mission is "to embed diversity, equity and inclusion at the heart of our business. To create a culture of belonging that empowers everyone to be their best authentic self. We commit to celebrating different perspectives and to continuously learning, developing and challenging ourselves and our partners."

We know we're on a journey. And far from perfect. But we want to be a part of the solution to the problem. It might not be comfortable or straightforward. But if we weren't up for doing the hard work and breaking the mould, we wouldn't be Sweaty Betty. We are committed to working across our business and with our DEI committee & DEI Collective to be champions, allies and inclusive, always. Because when we say all, we mean it.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Eviden, part of the Atos Group, with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion is a global leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 47,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.

The Opportunity


The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning team blend statistical techniques and ML to create value from data for our clients.
You will collaborate with business stakeholders to identify use cases and shape opportunities for delivering data science solutions, ensuring a clear connection to business benefits.
You'll extract, analyse, and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources, using algorithmic, data mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning and statistical tools, to make it accessible to our clients. You will then present your results using clear and engaging language in a way that bridges the fundamentally theoretical aspects of these initiatives to the business needs. This includes translating between technical and nontechnical audiences.
You will work across industries and technology platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) working with structured and unstructured data from an array of data sources.



 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities


Lead and deliver innovative technical solutions that will meet the requirements of our clients. This will entail gathering requirements, analysing, developing, testing, evaluating, and deploying the appropriate solution through the full development lifecycle.
Maintain clear and coherent communication, both verbal and written, to understand data needs and report results to technical and non-technical audiences.
Horizon scan to stay up to date with the latest technology, techniques, and methods.
Conduct research from which you'll develop prototypes and proof of concepts.
Manage and mentor junior team members.



 

Person Specification


Extensive experience in comprehending business challenges and converting this understanding into practical data science solutions.
Previous experience of delivering data science solutions using Microsoft Fabric and Azure DevOps or similar.
Passionate about the transformative impact the right information can have on a business.
Strong grasp of statistical methods, experimental design and the underlying principles of machine learning algorithms.
Ability to transform, analyse and model data from a variety of data sources, extracting and interpreting trends and insights.
Able to evaluate the models and experience of implementing them as stand-alone apps and as part of enterprise technology stacks. DataOps / MLOps experience would be valued.
Strong Python programming for modelling and/or data analysis is essential, preferably with experience using the spaCy NLP framework and BERT.
Knowledge of database design as well as strong experience with SQL queries is desirable. Familiarity with R and other common languages and tools would be beneficial.
Proficiency in stakeholder management and an effective, persuasive communication style to explain technical subjects to non-technical audiences.
Background in Mathematics or Physics and experience working within Agile projects as a team member and Scrum Master.



Eligibility Nice to have SC clearance or individuals with Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) who have been residing in the UK for the last 5 years are eligible to apply. Willing to travel if needed for client location (London).

We Care About Our Employees' Happiness By


25 days of Annual leave + an option to purchase more through our Flexible Benefits.
Flex benefits system – an exciting opportunity to choose your own benefits.
Retail discounts.
Pension - matching contribution up to 10%.
Private Medical Scheme.
Life Assurance.
Enrolment in our Share scheme - subject to scheme eligibility criteria.
Unlimited opportunities to learn in our Training platforms.



As a Disability Confident employer, we aim to ensure that people with disabilities who meet the minimum criteria for this position will be offered an interview. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments and changes as needed to the application and assessment process to remove or reduce any disadvantage associated with a person's disability.

Let’s grow together.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a growing team in the heart of London working on an AI based SaaS platform as a Data Analyst.

Responsibilities

Building dashboards and reports that support our Operations team in monitoring their performance
Building reports that we can send to our customers
Using SQL to get access to our data and building bespoke datasets and dashboards for our customers
Identifying opportunities for improvement in our processes
Talking to the users of your work to understand their needs
Spreadsheet manipulation and analysis




Qualifications

2+ Years experience writing SQL and interrogating data
Want to move beyond Excel for visualisations
Comfortable with hands-on application
Used data visualisation tools like Quicksight and Luzmo
Used AWS, especially RDS, MySQL or S3
Understanding of Python

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From hybrid working to flexible hours, we have plenty of options that help our people to thrive.

This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.

Job Description

Join us as a Data Analyst


Take on a challenge in the RBS International Data Management team, in which you’ll contribute to the analysis of RBS International business outcomes and key data elements (KDEs) to identify data quality issues, as well as business issues related to people, platform and processes
We’ll look to you to manage RBS International's business outcomes, provide high quality analytical input to help develop and implement innovative data profiling solutions, processes and resolve problems across the bank
This is a hands on role in which you'll hone your statistical and analytical data analysis expertise and gain valuable experience in a dynamic area of our business



What you'll do

As a Data Analyst, you'll play a key role in supporting the delivery of high quality business solutions. You’ll be performing data extraction, manipulation, processing and analysis, using the RBS International Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud based data quality detection engine and bank data profiling solutions, alongside developing and performing standard queries to ensure data quality and identify data inconsistencies and missing data.

Day-to-day, you’ll also be:


Managing RBS International's business outcomes
Collecting, profiling and mapping appropriate data to use in our AWS Cloud based data profiling solution as well as for ongoing data activities
Maintaining and developing the RBS International AWS DQ Detection Engine Business Rules and Rules Repository used for data profiling
Helping to develop Tableau dashboards to present statistical and analytical data quality results to Executive Data Owners (EDOs)
Working with other RBS International business areas in the identifying and documenting of data migration paths and processes, standardising KDE naming, data definitions, modelling and attending the NatWest Glossary Working Group
Helping to interpret customer needs and identifying operational risk issues, turning them into functional or data requirements and process models
Building and maintaining collaborative partnerships with key business stakeholders, including data domain leads, EDOs and EDO delegates



The skills you'll need

We’re looking for someone with experience of using data analysis tools and delivering data insights within a technology, data management, or data analytics function.

Detailed knowledge and evidence of application of, AWS, Structured Language Query (SQL), and JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) is an absolute requirement for this role.

We’ll also look for:


An in-depth understanding of the interrelationships of data and multiple data domains
A background in delivering research based on qualitative and quantitative data across a range of subjects
Excellent communication and influencing skills


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're hiring the very best data analysts to join our agile in-house team. You will be working on the fastest growing direct to consumer (e-commerce) brands and will have access to unlimited performance bonus.




What You'll Be Doing

Launch and optimize social, native and search advertising campaigns
Improve Conversion Rate across multiple funnels - multivariant and A/B testing
Design new funnels and analyse granular data using proprietary data warehouse
Manage unlimited budget while staying profitable. Compensation is directly correlated to your personal campaign performance and paid monthly
Optional managerial roles available




What You'll Need

Results-driven and numbers-oriented personality
High attention to detail
Flexibility and adaptability
Commitment to innovations




A little about us

We're passionate about building life changing consumer products and delivering them with astonishing service. We are also one of the UK's fastest growing direct to consumer companies.




The Benefits

Salary above market
All the latest tech you need
Pension plan

  • Commitment to innovations


A little about us

We're passionate about building life changing consumer products and delivering them with astonishing service. We are also one of the UK's fastest growing direct to consumer companies.


The Benefits

  • Salary above market
  • All the latest tech you need
  • Pension plan

Title: Research & Insights Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

We Are Social is a global socially-led creative agency with unrivalled social media expertise. With 1,300 people in 19 offices spanning four continents, we deliver a global perspective to our clients in a time when social media is shaping culture.

We're proud to be a multi award-winning agency, with Cannes Lions, One Show, Webby and Shorty Awards, to name but a few. Our most recent work has seen us help Pepsi, Meta and Adidas deliver some of their biggest and most innovative campaigns to date, from breaking into the metaverse to smashing records on TikTok.

As well as creating for clients, we help educate the wider industry. Our Instagram publication The Feed tracks culture at the speed of social. 6,500 people registered or tuned into our events last year, and our reports garnered more than 20 million views.

The Opportunity

Are you able to understand how social and behavioural trends are evolving and how to mine these for actionable insights for brands?

Do you feel comfortable with complex sets of data and feel proficient using pivot tables?

Are you an expert across tools such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, GWI and Emplify, using them to extensively generate insight? Are you happy to build dashboards and widgets without supervision?

Can you tailor your insights and reports to account for diverse and global audiences?

We are looking for a Research & Insights Analyst to be part of the Research & Insights team taking responsibility for the social media analysis and research products that are vital to the strategic direction of our consultancy and engagement plans.

We Are Social's Research & Insights team looks to deliver exceptionally high-quality results within three core service areas; Consultancy, Research & Insight and Engagement. We manipulate large sets of data, text and language in order to extract meaningful insights that can help shape recommendations and strategies.

The Research & Insights team serves both as a service to other We Are Social departments, and also works directly with clients on bespoke deep-dive projects. In addition, as the central hub for the We Are Social network the London Research & Insights team also supports other We Are Social offices.

Requirements

What You'll Have Delivered Elsewhere


Produced stellar regular and ad hoc research reports, including data collection, analysis, visualisation and commentary in delivering a project end-to-end within the agreed scope of work
Linked findings and recommendations to broader social, behavioural and cultural insights to ensure that these findings are adopted and implemented by the client.
Ensured there's a narrative and story to all work and allowed clients to easily understand the insights presented.
Interrogated a client brief and worked with internal teams across Strategy, Editorial and Creative in transforming research into world-class social campaigns.
Regularly present research and insight projects to internal stakeholders, teams and clients
Laddering social data up to business goals to demonstrate how campaigns have solved clients' business problems making sure we meet, exceed and develop the brief for the future.
Supporting Directors in managing projects as well as juniors within the team.


What Else Are We Looking For?


Sprinklr expert and have knowledge of Brandwatch, Netbase and Pulsar. Knowledge of audience segmentation tools is a plus.
Proven experience in consumer research and analytics, with a track record of interesting, innovative work that changed businesses.
A lover of music and an interest in FMCG brands.
If you can speak an additional language, in particular Spanish, German or Italian - this would be a bonus but not essential.


Benefits

Our Culture and the Nice Stuff

Equity, Diversity and Inclusion runs in the water here at We Are Social. We are transparent about the changes that are needed, we are focused on making real strides, both internally and within the industry and we strive to truly be a workplace that represents, supports and advocates for ALL. Our Charter for Change in the UK can be found here which details our focus areas across People, Work and Culture in 2023.

If you require any support, adjustments or accommodations for any reason whatsoever during the recruitment process, please let us know via recuitment@wearesocial.net

So let's get to the good stuff, we offer all those things you would naturally expect; 25 days holiday, pension scheme & life assurance. But what we love most is connection, so we have our WAS Passport and Work From Anywhere schemes which allow you to truly connect to colleagues all over the world!

About

But what's life around here really like day-to-day? Well, we ask our people regularly what they think about us/their role and here are some of the most common things they say:


I value my manager we have a good relationship
We love to ‘get social' with the people I work with
Trusted to get on with the job, without ‘micro-management'!


If this all sounds like the place you have been waiting to find then apply now! What are you waiting for?
Show more

Title: HR Systems and Data Analyst
Description:
Part Time Requirements - Flexibility offered in terms of days/times based on 21 hours per week, with some attendance in office 1-2 days per week dependent on schedule.







WHO WE ARE:




Peninsula is the leading provider of marine energy services and solutions globally.

For the last 25 years, we have positioned ourselves as the benchmark for quality in our industry.

We offer local knowledge on a global scale.




We are an experienced team of individuals who work collectively to meet all of our customer demands and needs. Having forged close relationships with our customers, our solutions are developed and driven by them. We have the ability to control our entire supply chain and thus offer quality products and services that are unique in today’s market.




Our reputation for transparency and a low risk tolerance, together with the highest standards of corporate governance and sanctions adherence, have combined to secure strong support for the group in financial and insurance markets.




WHAT YOU’LL DO:




The Systems & Data Analyst will be responsible for end to end HR systems and data management. Including new systems, requirements capture, analysis, design and implementation and optimisation of current HR systems. Reporting, analysis and interpretation of data, identifying trends to inform and support key decision making and leading data quality improvements.




A high level of data analytics as well as technical strength to work with multiple data sources will be required to succeed in this position, ideally with experience in an HR function.










MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES




Working with HR colleagues and stakeholders to translate business requirements into detailed system requirement documents and/or user stories that will either be used by our in-house software development team or by 3rd party organisations working on our behalf
System upgrades, implementations and ongoing development
Design, document and configure HR system workflows and efficient HR system processes
Make recommendations for system and data improvements based on industry trends and professional business knowledge
Creation of KPI dashboard for HR department and stakeholders
Analysis, design and implementation of new systems ensuring functionality or performance is not lost and new requirements are met
Enhance the automated connectivity and integrations between Peninsula’s in house systems to reduce manual process
Working with Operational Risk to ensure that existing business processes are maintained and any risks are reduced
Development of data flow diagrams and business process diagrams (current and future state)
Document problems / requirements and proposed solutions as part of a functional specification in line with company standards
Support continuous improvement initiatives across all HR data and systems, including design, configuration, testing and implementation.
Perform analytical testing and investigative work, assisting with the resolution of application support and maintenance issues where relevant
Produce technical documentation (Requirements Specification, Test Plan, Process Mapping and Data Flows)
Create and maintain user manuals, guides and other communication documentation for internal stakeholders/vendors
Manage system access permissions access ensuring sufficient segregation of duties
Improve training and operational procedures within business to increase efficiency and productivity
Identify data and reporting issues through analysing raw data and reports, identifying trends, gaps and inconsistencies.
Working with wider HR team to correct the data and identify root cause of the issues and how these can be mitigated in future
Developing regular reporting and data packs for HR and executive team members to support business decision making
Lead on data compliance ensuring data legislation guidelines are met, such as GDPR retention rules







KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE




Strong experience of HR systems, data and reporting; ideally understanding global challenges and solutions
Highly developed end to end project management skills
Advanced Power BI, Excel and Pivot Table skills
Excellent analytical skills and very high attention to detail
Strong troubleshooting, root cause analysis and problem-solving skills with high levels of attention to detail
Knowledge of system integration and the analysis needed to implement them
Good understanding of the principles of information security and segregation of duties
Actively share knowledge with the team and become an expert on data and processes,
Ability to work as part of a team and on own initiative in a constructive manner
Flexible, self-motivated and proactive
Excellent time management skills and ability to work on multiple projects at once, using strong time management skills and prioritisation
Ability to recommend practical ways using innovation, good judgement, creativity and strategic thinking
Excellent oral and written communication skills
External vendor management and selection skills
Negotiation, difficult conversation management and prioritisation skills

  • Negotiation, difficult conversation management and prioritisation skills

Title: Data Analyst - Alteryx
Description:
We require a Data Analyst ready to take on an exciting challenge in a fast-paced fintech / banking environment. Alteryx, Tableau AND SQL is ESSENTIAL




The right person is proactive, technically proficient professional to join a newly established IT Operations team. This is a great chance to shape the future of IT support, leveraging expertise of data analysis, transformation, and visualisation to drive operational excellence.




PRE QUALIFCICATION QUESTIONS:

Do you have significant experienced with: Alteryx, Tableau AND SQL (all 3)

Do you have experience in financial services? YES

Do you have experience in REST API? YES




CV's without the above will automatically be rejected due to the specific requirements of the role.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis & Insights: Collect, process, and analyse data to identify trends and actionable insights that support the smooth transition of IT operations.
Dashboards & Reporting: Design and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Tableau and other BI tools to track progress and highlight key issues.
Technical Expertise: Utilise tools like Alteryx, Alteryx Server, SQL, and Azure Functions to prepare and automate workflows.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of IT operations.
Process Optimisation: Identify opportunities for continuous improvement, implementing best practices to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Documentation: Create comprehensive process documentation to ensure smooth knowledge transfer and operational continuity.

What We’re Looking For:

Technical Skills: Strong expertise in Alteryx, SQL, Azure DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, and Tableau.
Analytical Thinking: Proven experience in analysing complex data and providing clear, actionable insights.
Collaboration & Communication: A team player with excellent interpersonal and presentation skills to engage stakeholders effectively.
Desirable: FX or financial systems experience and knowledge of Central Bank processes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Experience within short-term energy forecasting markets?




You'll be working across the company's suite of short-term forecasting tools, which has been built by a combination of machine-learning, optimisation and fundamental models within the short-term trading space.




The team is at the forefront of the energy revolution, driving innovation to power a sustainable future. Delivering reliable, affordable, and clean energy solutions to customers while reducing our environmental footprint.




The business is already a well established leader within their domain. However, they like to keep team sizes quite small as they want people to have a major say and influence on projects.




Role Overview:

Coding knowledge, in Python, C# or another equivalent language
Experience of the energy power markets
An appetite for problem-solving, turning real-world challenges into impactful tools
Interpersonal, organisational and project management skills
Writing, data analysis and presentation skills




The successful Data Analyst will earn up to £55,000 and in addition there are exceptional benefits which come as part of the overall package including: 15% Bonus, 8% Pension contribution, training fund, weekly team lunches, travel loans and numerous soft leisurely benefits. The team tends to come together 2 days a week for some collaboration, but only when it adds value to do so.




Spencer Scott Ltd is an equal opportunity Recruitment Agency, which means we do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. We celebrate diversity and are committed to create inclusive working environments for all our clients.

Title: Business Analyst - Data
Description:
Job Introduction

This role will sit in our Technology function partnering closely with our Product organisation and the Business. A key part of this role is to help develop our Agile mindset that facilitates regular, repeatable and reliable change across technology platforms, in line with the Technology strategy and roadmap. As a business analyst you will work in close collaboration with the business, product and engineering to analyse, review, define and shape new technology solutions, and be responsible for the requirements definition and analysis for new technology products and platforms. Specifically, this role will have a strong data focus and support Selfridges Enterprise Data & Finance data squads and initiatives.

As The Business Analyst You Will


Plan and estimate the business analysis activities and deliverables required within a given initiative.
Support Product with the definition and documentation of the business problem or opportunity and contribute to establishing the business case and gaining commitment to the change.
Work with the Business, Product and Engineering teams to identify and define the requirements using multiple techniques including (but not limited to) workshops, observation, interviews and creation of workflow models.
Work as part of a technology Squad and being actively involved in backlog refinement, sprint planning, sprint reviews, retrospectives and the daily stand-up (including demos/showcases) and ensure all projects have the required assets at the appropriate stages of the delivery lifecycle.
Elicit, validate, refine and manage the requirements within a given initiative, including defining the non-functional requirements, using appropriate tools and techniques.
Ensure that all requirements are well structured, clear and defined, with each requirement having valid and complete acceptance criteria.
Develop and document data mapping specifications to specify how source data is mapped to target systems data, along with the required business & transformation rules.
Perform data gap analysis of key problem areas to assist in root cause analysis.
Demonstrate an understanding of SQL, relational databases, reporting tools (e.g. Power BI) and have experience of data modelling and cataloguing tools.
Manage the risks and issues associated with requirements definition and the broader business analysis activities.
Collaborate with the Business and Product teams to agree, define and document the business processes associated with all new solutions inc. “as-is” business process analysis, aligned to industry (BPMN) and Selfridges standards.
Manage and track requirements as they move from discovery through to implementation. Identify when new requirements change the scope of the overall solution and ensure that the appropriate change control processes are followed, including accurate impact assessment.
Collaborate with the Quality Engineering team to validate the test scenarios defined by them, ensure the appropriate level of test coverage is in place and that exception scenarios are well thought through against the requirements and support the quality activities through the delivery lifecycle.
Actively support the UAT (e.g. test case creation) and provide knowledge and expertise to support defect resolution.
Actively support (and undertake where necessary) business change activities e.g. training.
Fully understand the implementation of existing solutions within the domain and how they fit with the overall systems architecture.
Understand modern technology concepts, grasp new ones quickly and appreciate their implications on delivery.
Proven experience of delivering high quality, customer focused analysis in a complex and changing environment, in both Agile and Waterfall delivery environments.
You will report to a Senior Business Analyst and work closely with the broader IT community and third parties.
A passion for retail, heritage brands and a desire to learn deeply about our customer needs


How You’ll Do It…you Will Have


Leadership. You hold yourself and others accountable to meet commitments and role model excellent behaviours and lead through both success and failure with a high focus on outcomes.
Judgement. Ability to make informed decisions based upon analysis, experience, and judgement, with data driven decisions at the fore.
Stakeholder Management. Comfortable challenging the status quo respectfully, providing advice to improve delivery. Ability to manage and engage multiple stakeholders providing the right updates and insight at the right points. Builds strong relationships and trust quickly at all levels of the organisation with both business and technical stakeholders.
Communication. An excellent communicator, both verbal and written. Ability to present information that it is engaging, well-structured and appropriate for the given audience.
Collaboration. Builds partnerships with internal and external stakeholders & suppliers and works collaboratively with others, bringing them together to meet shared objectives.
Problem Solving. Able to foresee and resolve potential bottlenecks, delays and barriers to delivery. Seeks solutions to problems in a practical and pragmatic way, demonstrating a logical and analytical approach.
Business Insight. Applies knowledge of the business and the marketplace to advance the organisation's goals. Demonstrates a customer focused mindset and a clear understanding of how own activities relate to critical business drivers and customer outcomes.
Action Oriented. Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm. Takes timely action on important or difficult issues. Identifies and pursues new opportunities that benefit the organization.
Passion for Business Analysis. Passionate and knowledgeable about Business Analysis and industry best practice. Someone who is keen to be actively involved and contribute to the Business Analysis community
Data Knowledge. Experience of working on data platform projects and knowledge of data solutions and systems. Be knowledgeable of different methodologies and best practices for data extraction, transformation, and load (e.g. ELT) between different applications and technologies.


Selfridges
Show more

  • Communication. An excellent communicator, both verbal and written. Ability to present information that it is engaging, well-structured and appropriate for the given audience.
  • Collaboration. Builds partnerships with internal and external stakeholders & suppliers and works collaboratively with others, bringing them together to meet shared objectives.
  • Problem Solving. Able to foresee and resolve potential bottlenecks, delays and barriers to delivery. Seeks solutions to problems in a practical and pragmatic way, demonstrating a logical and analytical approach.
  • Business Insight. Applies knowledge of the business and the marketplace to advance the organisation's goals. Demonstrates a customer focused mindset and a clear understanding of how own activities relate to critical business drivers and customer outcomes.
  • Action Oriented. Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm. Takes timely action on important or difficult issues. Identifies and pursues new opportunities that benefit the organization.
  • Passion for Business Analysis. Passionate and knowledgeable about Business Analysis and industry best practice. Someone who is keen to be actively involved and contribute to the Business Analysis community
  • Data Knowledge. Experience of working on data platform projects and knowledge of data solutions and systems. Be knowledgeable of different methodologies and best practices for data extraction, transformation, and load (e.g. ELT) between different applications and technologies.

Selfridges

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst


Location: London (Hybrid - 2 days per week onsite)

Duration: 6 Months (via Umbrella)

Sector: Financial Services

Overview:

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join a leading financial services organisation on a 6-month initial contract. The successful candidate will be responsible for analysing API data to assess compliance with data standards, generate insights, and support strategic decision-making. This role requires previous experience in financial services and expertise in data analysis, reporting, and dashboard creation.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyse API data to evaluate compliance with data standards and identify areas for improvement.
Develop insights from API data and usage patterns to demonstrate value and inform strategic decisions.
Create reports and dashboards to track adoption KPIs and effectively communicate results to senior stakeholders.
Provide recommendations for improving metadata quality and API discoverability based on data insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance data governance and API analytics strategies.


Key Requirements:


Previous experience in financial services is essential.
Strong expertise in data analysis, reporting, and visualisation tools (e.g., SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau).
Experience working with API data, metadata, and usage analytics.
Ability to communicate complex data insights to senior stakeholders in a clear and impactful manner.
Familiarity with data governance and compliance standards in the financial sector.


Contract Details:


Duration: 6 months (potential for extension).

Location: Hybrid - 2 days per week in London.
Engagement: Inside IR35 - via Umbrella Company.


If you are a Data Analyst with experience in financial services and a passion for API data insights, we would love to hear from you!

Apply now to be considered for this exciting opportunity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are BOB, a hybrid L2 to build and launch Bitcoin applications. Our mission is accelerating the world’s transition to a fair and transparent financial system through Bitcoin as a credibly neutral, global settlement asset. We believe in a world with access to finance for everyone, everywhere, in a secure and usable manner.

As a Data Analyst for BOB, you will be leading the quantitative insights to grow and direct decisions at BOB. You are the main person responsible for analysing various on- and off-chain data sources to create and track KPIs and identify trends with a deep product understanding. You will work closely with the product, business, and marketing teams to formulate hypothesis and deliver actionable recommendations focussing on DeFi on BOB.

What You Will Do


Product Metrics and Reporting: Track, analyse, and report on key performance metrics, including channel performance, user activation and retention, TVL, trading volume, and other KPIs.
Market Research: Conduct in-depth market analysis to identify emerging trends within the Bitcoin and DeFi ecosystem.
Identify DeFi Opportunities: Regularly prepare and update reports about investment opportunities on BOB for our institutional partners.
Data Infrastructure: Together with the engineering team, design and build foundational data systems, including ETLs, dashboards, and analytics that drive data-driven decision-making and support scalable business growth.


Requirements


Proven ability to lead complex analytical projects from concept to completion, especially in web3 environments.
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python through your experience as business or data analyst or other quant-related position.
Deep understanding of DeFi, including protocols, block explorers, and data sources.
Eagerness to improve products through fast experimentation, A/B testing, and a data-driven approach.
Enjoy working in a results-driven and fast-paced startup environment.


Benefits


Research-oriented team
Solve novel problems
Stock options
Remote working
30-day vacation
Allowance for a co-working space
Yearly retreat
Show more

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
£40.000 - £43.500
Permanent
Near Epsom, Surrey (location is most easily reached by own transport)
Hybrid working (3 days a week in the office)
Generous benefits package (Performance related bonus, Pension, access to their car scheme, Birthday voucher, Cycle Scheme, holiday purchase scheme, discounted onsite gym membership, subsidised Café and Canteen, 25 days holiday + all bank holidays)




TLP have been working with Toyota (GB) PLC for over 25 years and are a trusted partner. This role will be employed by TLP (secondment to Toyota (GB) PLC)




We have an exciting opportunity within the Performance and Optimization team, responsible for the data analysis, design and the development of digital platform reporting solutions within Customer Engagement and Marketing teams. The data will help the business by collecting, visualizing, analyzing and interpreting website and marketing data to inform key business decision from marketing investment, website improvement opportunities and platform development.

This role will shape and implement new processes that provide insights to improve the digital experience and influencing business teams and commercial decisions at all levels.




What you’ll be doing:




Design & build reports and dashboards using Power BI
Performing data analysis and profiling of key sources to evaluate quality and integrity
Performing ad hoc / exploratory analysis of data sets to find insights, patterns or trends
Collaborating with Data Engineering teams to define and test data sets / models for digital analytics
Working with agency partners to manage the production and maintenance of performance dashboards delivered in other platforms (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Looker Studio)
Maintaining consistency and quality in digital data by ensuring correct tagging and tracking of key platforms in collaboration with agency partners (GA4, GTM, Adobe Analytics)
Leading the adoption and understanding of reports and data models across wider business teams
Defining and documenting metrics and KPIs, working with internal teams to ensure new products and content is accurately tagged and KPIs are defined
Collaborating with colleagues and business stakeholders to gather, analyse and document digital reporting and analytics requirements
Monitoring and analysis of production issues, collaborating with wider teams in effective resolution
Manage the design, development and maintenance of performance dashboards across several analytics tools, including Adobe Analytics, Power BI and Google Looker Studio. To enable better self-service across the Marketing Communications Team
Identify the most effective techniques, data sets and tools to execute functional and non-functional test cases.
Use advanced SQL to extract, clean and manipulate large datasets from various sources.
Collaborate with data engineering teams to define data sets and models to support digital analytics
Maintain digital data quality excellence working with.
Toyota Europe and local agency teams to ensure tagging and technical requirements are implemented correctly across our analytics tools including GA4/Adobe Analytics/GTM
Ensure digital tagging and tracking procedures are communicated and followed within all marketing activity to enable accurate reporting and analytics.
Provide basic training and guidance to encourage wider stakeholders to use analytics tools and reports to self-serve data for their needs and foster a culture of data driven decision making across the business




Qualifications and Experience




Essential

3+ years of experience in Digital marketing data analytics and delivery or equivalent experience
Experience using following Tech stacks - Power BI, SQL, Python, Azure, Snowflake, and Google Analytics
Excellent communications skills, creative problem solver, critical thinking capabilities
Strong organisational and time management skills




Desirable

Automotive industry experience
Bachelor’s degree, level 4+ apprenticeship (or equivalent) in Data Analytics or a similar discipline.
Relevant Microsoft & Azure certifications (e.g. Power BI Data Analyst Associate

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We generate millions of datapoints each day, and we're hiring our first Data Analyst to help make sense of them.

The electricity grid is changing beyond recognition, and without deploying new software to orchestrate it, we'll be unable to decarbonise.

At Axle, we're building the infrastructure that'll underpin the decarbonised energy system. Our software crushes CO2 and energy costs. Our goal is insanely ambitious, and we're building a team to match the scale of this challenge. We've just raised a Seed round from world-leading investors including Accel (TechCrunch) and we're growing fast.

We make the technology to move energy usage to times when electricity is cheap and green. Our software controls vehicle charging, heating systems, and home batteries. We use machine learning to figure out what energy people will need, and when they'll need it. We control tens of thousands of energy assets, and we're growing quickly.

Axle is a unique startup. We're building in a legacy industry and moving gigawatt-hours of electrons in the real world, but we operate at lightning speed. We ship extraordinarily quickly, and we're experts in electricity systems. We're backed by some of the best investors in the world, and we're growing the team to meet customer demand.

Requirements

Read more about what we're building here.

At Axle, we read data from hundreds of thousands of devices every day. We then optimize the performance of those devices, and participate in electricity markets with them. As our business grows, we're looking for a driven data analyst to help build reporting, monitoring, and visualization across the business.

Some things you might work on:


Visualizing the charging patterns of thousands of electric vehicles
Building dashboards to help us understand which devices are online
Tracking our financial performance vs our revenue targets



You'll need:


Tech chops: you'll need comfort with SQL and basic Python knowledge to work with and automate our data processes
Strong analytical skills: you'll be speaking MW, kWh, and £ every day
Commercial instincts: we're looking for somebody who can help us spot opportunities lurking in our data!
A deep-seated motivation to combat climate change
Comfort moving fast in an uncertain and changeable environment



You can expect:


insane amounts of ownership
lots of fascinating data to get to grips with
the support of a world class engineering & commercial team


This role would suit an ambitious generalist with a strong analytical background. We don't care if you've held a role with a similar title before: if you've got a track record of getting things done in complex, data-heavy environments, let's chat.

Interview process


Initial interview
Take-home exercise
Final interview (in-person)
Offer, references, and welcome to the team!



Benefits

We love the idea of fully remote work but it doesn't... work. For very early stage companies, people learn faster, get on better, and accomplish more when they're spending a decent chunk of time together. We ask that you spend 2-3 days a week in our London office.

We are extremely keen to build a diverse company, and we're particularly eager to hear from candidates who don't fit the traditional role stereotypes. If you're motivated by our mission, please do reach out, even if you feel you might not ‘check all the boxes'.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Subscriptions
Description:
Data Analyst - Subscriptions & Analytics - Power BI




Location: Central London




Compensation: £50,000 - £70,000 + Benefits




Type: Permanent




Are you ready to propel your career to new heights with a dynamic digital company who are truly value driven ? We're on the hunt for a talented Data Analyst who boasts a solid background in subscriptions and audience insights. If you're adept with Power BI and have a passion for turning data into actionable intelligence, we want to hear from you!




What You’ll Do:




Join a vibrant team where you’ll play a pivotal role in enhancing our subscriptions business. Your responsibilities will span a diverse range of tasks in an agile, fast-paced environment:




Harness data analysis to drive subscription growth initiatives.
Design and implement sophisticated data models for seamless automated reporting.
Analyze and refine audience segments to tailor our offerings.
Create engaging and insightful Power BI reports, while continually enhancing existing ones.
Ensure the integrity and flow of data and analytics within our systems.
Collaborate with product and audience stakeholders to refine data needs and insights.




Key Qualifications:




Proven experience in data and audience analytics, particularly in Power BI development.
Proficient in Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, or similar tools.
Strong familiarity with marketing metrics and data from social media platforms.
Expertise in Power BI, including DAX and M for effective data modelling and visualization.
Competent in connecting to both SQL and non-SQL data sources.
Detail-oriented approach with a robust command of SQL for conducting data quality assessments and ad hoc analyses.
Understanding of data migration, ETL processes, and relational data structures.
Excellent communication skills, characterized by confidence and proactivity.
A data-driven mindset with the ability to conceptualize the end-to-end data process.
A degree in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, science, or computer science is preferred.

Title: Aerodynamic Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

For almost 50 years, Williams Racing has been at the forefront of one of the fastest sports on the planet, being one of the top three most successful teams in history competing in the FIA Formula 1 World Championship. With an almost unrivalled heritage of engineering and racing F1 cars and unforgettable eras that demonstrate it is a force to be reckoned with, the British squad boasts 16 F1 World Championship titles to its name.

Since its foundation in 1977 by the eminent, late Sir Frank Williams and engineering pioneer Sir Patrick Head, the team has won nine Constructors’ Championships, in association with Cosworth, Honda and Renault. Its roll call of drivers is legendary, with its seven Drivers’ Championship trophies being lifted by true icons of the sport: Alan Jones, Keke Rosberg, Nelson Piquet, Nigel Mansell, Alain Prost, Damon Hill and Jacques Villeneuve. The team has made history before and is out to make it again with a long-term mission to evolve and return to the front of the grid.

Job Description

Williams Racing is looking for a highly analytical and innovative engineer to enhance the correlation between Wind Tunnel, CFD, and track performance. This role is crucial in ensuring our simulation and part selection methodologies translate seamlessly to real-world track conditions.

Working in the Aerodynamic Correlation and Methods group, you will collaborate across multiple departments, including Trackside Aero, Vehicle Performance, CFD, Wind Tunnel, and Aero Development, using cutting-edge tools and techniques to push performance boundaries.

What You’ll Be Doing


Optimising Wind Tunnel to Track Correlation – Analysing and refining simulation environments for improved accuracy.
Defining & Analysing DIL Experiments – Understanding aero performance sensitivities and their impact on lap time.
Improving CFD Simulations – Identifying deficiencies and working closely with the CFD team to enhance accuracy.
Leading R&D Projects – Driving new instrumentation capabilities and data analysis improvements.
Enhancing Data Toolsets – Collaborating with software engineers to develop cutting-edge performance analysis tools.
Cross-Department Collaboration – Contributing to whole car simulation correlation to unlock new performance gains.


Who We’re Looking For


A strong communicator and collaborator with the ability to work seamlessly across technical groups.
A passionate problem-solver with a solid understanding of dynamic systems and optimisation.
Experience in performance and correlation data analysis, with a background in vehicle dynamics being a plus.
Knowledge of aerodynamics and aerodynamic data interpretation is highly beneficial.
Proficiency in scientific coding languages and the ability to develop data analysis tools.
Ability to present complex analysis in a clear, data-driven and insightful way.
Degree in Aerodynamics, Aeronautical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Data Science (or equivalent).


Why Join Williams Racing?


Work at the cutting edge of aero performance innovation
Collaborate with AI/ML engineers to revolutionize data-driven decision-making
Be part of a high-performance, fast-paced F1 environment
Work on groundbreaking projects that directly impact race performance


Additional Information

Williams is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We are happy to discuss reasonable job adjustments.


Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Lyst offers a unique opportunity to work on a premium shopping platform, which is both a trusted partner to the world's leading fashion brands and a global consumer-facing product. Over 150 million people use the Lyst app and website each year to shop an assortment of 8 million items via a highly personalised experience. Lyst is a scale-up environment, combining an agile mentality with a proven business model and over a decade of experience. This provides a balance between foundations and structure, and autonomy and pace. Our goal is to be the category leading destination which every fashion shopper uses to decide what to buy.

Data and technology sit at the heart of everything we do, and we firmly believe that we can only meet our goals by prioritising our team and culture. We give our people the freedom to drive impact and shape the future of our company, within a diverse, inclusive and high-trust environment. We don't rely on prescriptive rules, policies and procedures to drive results. We trust the judgement and ownership of our team, and prioritise learning and career development, knowing that our success is only possible thanks to our people. Lyst was founded in London in 2010, and has raised over $160m from leading investors including Accel, Balderton, Draper Esprit, Fidelity International, and LVMH.

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our Analytics Chapter, comprised of Analysts and Analytics Engineers. In the role, you'll work closely with stakeholders across the organisation in Marketing, Product and Partnerships.

Responsibilities:


Defining measurement plans and commercial success: You'll enable Marketing to try new tests as we seek to identify and acquire new audiences. You'll create campaign measurement frameworks and criteria. You'll be comfortable turning the data into actionable commercial insights
Partnering with Marketing and Commercial teams: You'll be a key partner to Marketing in everything they do, identifying how analytics can be an enabler and accelerant for Marketing performance
Thought leadership: You'll adopt and instantiate concepts and techniques that ensure Lyst are at the forefront of Marketing analytics techniques. You'll ideally have experience in lifetime value modelling, incrementality testing and MMM
Supporting strategic business reviews: Contribute to strategic business reviews, presenting data-driven insights that influence company strategy
Mentor analysts: Provide technical guidance to other team members, seeking to foster a culture of continuous learning and support within Analytics
Develop Metrics and KPIs: Establish and maintain metrics and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives and help measure success



Requirements


Marketing Skills: Expertise in Marketing, with experience working across different acquisition channels on app and web
Modeling Skills: Experience working on advanced modelling concepts
SQL and Statistical Analysis: Strong proficiency in SQL and statistical methods for analyzing complex data sets
Proven experience in conducting impact analysis to assess viable opportunities and scoping their relevance
Track Record: A successful track record of managing complex projects that involve cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders
Highly autonomous and comfortable with accountability; experience working across all levels within an organisation
Behavioural Qualities: Strong commitment to team success and Lyst's values



Benefits


Our Ways of Working: We all come into the office on Tuesdays and Thursdays, with the option to work remotely or come into the office on the other days. We believe that in person collaboration and community spirit is super important, which is why we spend some of our time in the office and some of our time at home
Time Off: In addition to the 8 statutory bank holidays, you will receive 29 holidays per year. Lyst's holiday year runs from 1 April to 31 March
Competitive Family Leave Package: This includes Enhanced Family Leave for those eligible, paid Time off for Dependents and Support for Fertility Treatment & Loss
Clothing Benefit: We want you to enjoy using the Lyst app and site as much as our customers, so we provide you with a clothing allowance to use on Lyst every year. This starts at £250 when you join and increases up to £1,000 with your length of service
Private Healthcare: Our healthcare provider is Vitality. Your health is important to us which is why we offer all employees a comprehensive healthcare scheme from the day you start
Training Allowance: We're big on continuous learning and growth, so all employees are currently entitled to an annual training allowance of £1,000. This can be used to attend conferences, industry events, training courses and to purchase resources
Pension Scheme: Our pension provider is The People's Pension. We offer a minimum employee contribution of 5% and 3% employer contribution
Eye Tests and Vouchers: Employees can make a saving on their eye test and glasses through our chosen provider. You'll receive a free eye test every year and a discount towards glasses
Cycle-to-Work Scheme: Lyst will purchase a bicycle from your chosen retailer, you will then receive a voucher to pick up your bicycle from them
Transport Season Ticket Loan: Employees can apply for an interest free season ticket loan to support your travel to work
Social Events: Frequent company wide social events including Christmas & summer parties, sports days, themed drinks, quizzes, cook alongs, as well as smaller team socials. We also have plenty of interest based groups such as football, running club, book club, culinary and more


We want to build a world where fashion works for everyone, and we want teams that are just as inclusive. Diversity and inclusion is an integral part of our culture at Lyst. We recognise and celebrate the value and impact diversity brings to our company and are committed to ensuring this is a consistent focus, for which we are held to account. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and equally, and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply for this role. We are happy to talk about flexible working arrangements.

Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Lyst we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
Show more

Lyst offers a unique opportunity to work on a premium shopping platform, which is both a trusted partner to the world's leading fashion brands and a global consumer-facing product. Over 150 million people use the Lyst app and website each year to shop an assortment of 8 million items via a highly personalised experience. Lyst is a scale-up environment, combining an agile mentality with a proven business model and over a decade of experience. This provides a balance between foundations and structure, and autonomy and pace. Our goal is to be the category leading destination which every fashion shopper uses to decide what to buy.

Data and technology sit at the heart of everything we do, and we firmly believe that we can only meet our goals by prioritising our team and culture. We give our people the freedom to drive impact and shape the future of our company, within a diverse, inclusive and high-trust environment. We don't rely on prescriptive rules, policies and procedures to drive results. We trust the judgement and ownership of our team, and prioritise learning and career development, knowing that our success is only possible thanks to our people. Lyst was founded in London in 2010, and has raised over $160m from leading investors including Accel, Balderton, Draper Esprit, Fidelity International, and LVMH.

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
About the role

As part of the HR Systems team, you will join the wider HR function to provide support to the business globally.




In this role you will be able to generate reports that will support decision making across the business and improve workflow across all functions.

You will identify critical gaps in data management, process optimization, and cross-regional administrative support within the HR function.




This is an important role for the wider HR function as it will enhance operational efficiency and free capacity for the team to focus on strategic priorities.




Requirements

For this role, you will have:

• A university degree with 2-5 years relevant experience

• Strong HR administration and technical capability

• Experience with data analysis, and utilizing data analysis tools such as SQL or SSRS

• Familiarity with HRIS/HRMS and other HR business intelligence tools (Power BI preferred).

• Effective communication and interpersonal skills, facilitating stakeholder engagement across multiple levels.

• Organizational and project management expertise, with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks.

• Commitment to confidentiality, security, and adherence to data privacy regulations.

• Strong Microsoft Office skills with advanced ability in Excel is a must




Required Skills:

• Analytical Skills

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

• Excellent communication skills

• Excellent organizational skills

• Excellent interpersonal skills

• Attention to detail







Why Harneys?

Harneys is a global offshore law firm with entrepreneurial thinking built around professionalism, personal service and rapid response. Open, progressive and personable, we provide advice on British Virgin Islands, Cayman Islands, Cyprus, Bermuda and Anguilla law to an international client base which includes the world’s top law firms, financial institutions, investment funds and private individuals. Our network is the largest among offshore law firms, with locations in major financial centres across Europe, Asia, the Americas and the Caribbean, allowing us to provide services of the highest quality to clients in their own languages and time zones.

Harneys is strictly an equal opportunities employer and we recognise the benefits of diversity.




Led by a senior team of experienced offshore lawyers and located in the heart of one of the world's largest financial centres, Harneys London opened in 2002 and services a strong base of clients in the UK and throughout Europe. The firm’s London lawyers provide a full range of offerings across all practice areas and specialisms.

Title: Data Analyst - Excel
Description:
DATA ANALYST - EXCEL

£250-£300 PER DAY OUTSIDE IR35

LONDON (1/2 DAYS IN THE OFFICE)

6 MONTH CONTRACT

THE COMPANY:

Join a data-driven company as a Data Analyst and help drive their data initiatives.

THE ROLE:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a huge role in enhancing the company's operational efficiency by creating and maintaining complex Excel and Business Objects business intelligence reports.

Your responsibilities will include:

Developing advanced Excel spreadsheets, including macros and VBA programming.
Supporting ad hoc data analysis.
Automating existing processes and data pipelines in R and/or Python.
Improving data accuracy and quality.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements.
Troubleshooting and maintaining existing Excel reports.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Data Analyst will be required to have the following experience:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Advanced skills in Excel, R and/or Python.
Business Objects experience is a plus!
Strong communication skills.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Mojola Coker via the apply link on this page.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: SC Cleared Data Analyst

Location: London (Onsite 3 days per week)

Contract Type: 3-month contract with potential for extension

Rate: £400 per day (Inside IR35)

Role Overview

We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst to join our team in a client-facing, data-driven role. The successful candidate will work on an AWS infrastructure-based data platform, focusing on reviewing, correcting, and separating inaccurate or merged data. This role involves working with confidential information and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and integrity.

Key Responsibilities

Data Integrity: Review and correct inaccurate identities across various systems to ensure accurate data representation.
Workload Management: Independently manage workloads to meet deadlines while balancing conflicting priorities.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders to deliver high-quality results.
Analytical Thinking: Objectively assess complex information from multiple sources to draw meaningful conclusions.
Technical Application: Utilise Python scripting, Atlassian toolsets and other technologies to perform data corrections and analysis.
Confidentiality: Handle sensitive and confidential information in a secure and professional manner.

Required Skills and Experience

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret and process complex datasets.
Proficiency in Python scripting for automation and data manipulation.
Familiarity with AWS infrastructure and related tools.
Experience working with sensitive data in compliance with regulations.
Excellent communication skills for engaging with clients and stakeholders.
Ability to adapt quickly to changing circumstances and prioritise tasks effectively.

Title: Data Analyst Associate
Description:
My leading Financial Services client are looking for a Data Analyst to join their CLM and KYC team, within their Data & MI space. You'll be responsible for the production and maintenance of the Data & MI function, including uploading and oversight to the internal reporting repository.




This is a newly created role within a hugely growing area of the organisation. They are a supportive and high performing team, a brilliant opportunity!




The following skills / experience is required:

Strong Data Analyst background
Power BI
SQL, Excel, Python is desirable
KYC understanding is desirable
Previously worked in Financial Services or similar industry
Excellent communication skills




Salary: Up to £60,000 + bonus + package

Grade: Associate

Location: London (good work from home options available)




If you are interested and meet the above requirements please apply immediately.

Title: Data Analyst, UK
Description:
Description

About Reserv

Reserv is an insurtech creating and incubating cutting-edge AI and automation technology to bring efficiency and simplicity to claims. Founded by insurtech veterans with deep experience in SaaS and digital claims, Reserv is venture-backed by Bain Capital and Altai Ventures and began operations in May 2022. We are focused on automating highly manual tasks to tackle long-standing problems in claims and set a new standard for TPAs, insurance technology providers, and adjusters alike.

We have ambitious (but attainable!) goals and need people who can work in an evolving environment. If building a leading TPA and the prospect of tackling the long-standing challenges of the claims role sounds exciting, we can't wait to meet you.

About the role

As an analyst in a well-funded Series B stage start-up, you will be defining our growth potential for years to come. You will be an integral part of Reserv's data organization, working with our customers to deliver exemplary data management of their claims portfolios.

For this role, we are seeking an analytics professional with strong technical skills and the desire to learn and grow in their role. This role will require you to own day to day reporting and analyses for our customers, all the while automating away mundane and repetitive reporting, while building processes with the operations team that benefit our data asset.

What we need

We need you to do all the things typical to the role:


Work with our data stack: Python (Pandas to Langchain), Postgres, Looker, ECS, Docker etc.
Ship reporting code and operational processes that solve for our customers' needs.
Serve as the analyst responsible for our monthly reporting packages.
Liaise with our operations teams solving for nuanced data issues.
Communicate ideas and specifications through detailed, precise writing.
Influence the culture, values, and processes of a growing technology team.
Enjoy and have fun being creative and thinking outside of the box. You will need to draw on analogous situations you've worked on before, but we are not traversing well-traveled roads. "Where we're going, we don't need roads!"


Requirements


3-5 years of experience in a data science or analytics role, preferably within the insurance and/or claims space, with experience working independently / in a small team.
Have a proven track record of shipping high quality data analysis at a high cadence.
Experience using modern analytics and programming languages with an emphasis on statistical analysis.
A proven ability to manage relationships with high value customers and communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences alike.
The ability to wear adjacent hats as you grow your scope: analyst, developer, customer manager.
A passion for building intuitive technology and a thirst for learning.


Benefits


Generous health-insurance package
Pension plan with employer contributions
Competitive holiday / leave policy in addition to bank holidays – we want our employees fresh, healthy, happy, and energized!
Industry Qualifications paid by us (after a qualifying period)
Work from anywhere to facilitate your work-life balance
Apple laptop, large second monitor, and other quality-of-life equipment. Technology is something that should make your life easier, not harder!


At Reserv, we value diversity in backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences and believe that diversity in viewpoints and critical thinking drives innovation, first-principles thinking, and success. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and encourage those from all walks of life to apply. If you believe you are a good fit for this role, we would love to hear from you!
