Title: Business Operations Analytics Associate
Description:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Operations at Brex

The Operations team is the bridge between our product and our customers. Our priority is to keep our customers happy and their businesses protected, while delivering vital information back to our internal teams. We are responsible for underwriting all of our customers, while simultaneously managing Brex’s risk exposures. We work cross-functionally with Compliance, Data, Product, and Engineering to allow Brex to scale efficiently, keeping quality top of mind.

What You’ll Do

The Business Operations Analytics team is a crucial component of the Operations organization, dedicated to driving excellence in customer experience, protecting the company's bottom line, and enabling business growth through data-driven insights. As a Business Operations Analytics Associate, you will play a key role in shaping our operational strategy by delivering comprehensive analytical solutions that optimize processes, enhance customer satisfaction, and safeguard profitability. You’ll partner with teams across credit, fraud, compliance, banking, and growth to identify challenges, develop data-driven solutions, and drive strategic initiatives.

Where you’ll work

This role will be based in our Vancouver office. You must be willing to work in office at least 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday, starting the week of January 6th, 2025. Employees will be able to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, for a minimum of one week at a time.

Responsibilities


Address business challenges by analyzing problems with moderate complexity and contributing to actionable solutions that align with business needs.
Perform data analysis and insights delivery by leveraging intermediate data wrangling techniques to extract, clean, and analyze datasets, providing recommendations that support cross-functional objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to understand their needs, deliver data-driven insights, and recommend improvements to enhance decision-making and operational efficiency.
Identify process improvement opportunities within specific business areas, proposing and helping implement solutions to drive efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and performance improvements.
Take ownership of medium-scale projects and initiatives, managing them from planning to execution with guidance from senior team members, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Communicate insights and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at various levels, building the case for proposed initiatives and ensuring alignment on next steps.
Contribute to high-priority projects by coordinating efforts, tracking progress, and maintaining alignment with strategic objectives, escalating risks and challenges as necessary.
Develop and maintain strong stakeholder relationships, serve as a key point of contact for cross-functional collaboration, and ensure alignment with team and organizational goals.


Requirements


A bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Data Science, Operations Management, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in analytics and leading data-driven strategy, preferably within the fintech or financial services industry, with a proven ability to drive impact
Proven experience in advanced analytics and the ability to identify and solve complex business problems using data-driven insights with proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL/Hex/Snowflake, Python)
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present insights and gain buy-in from stakeholders at all levels; influence without authority
Proven ability to navigate ambiguity, bringing clarity to undefined problems
Experience in owning projects end-to-end, driving initiatives from concept to execution with minimal supervision
Adaptable to changing business needs, with a commitment to continuous learning and development
Must be willing to work in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday


Bonus


Experience with credit risk management, fraud risk management in the payment industry is a plus


Compensation

The expected salary range for this role is $97,600 - $122,000 CAD. However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.

Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.

Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Canada.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Canada for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Apply Online Today!

Title: Datascience Co-op
Description:
Be part of something incredible. Metals are necessary for our world, but mining historically faced issues with waste, sustainability, and inefficiencies. MineSense is changing that. Our solutions reduce mining waste and environmental impacts while increasing profits and efficiencies. Backed by the best in venture capital and government funds, and recognized by tech industry and sustainability programs, MineSense is doing what many said could not be done: improving mining for people and planet.




Statistics and machine learning play a critical role in the development and operation of MineSense products. To help develop the software and machine learning models, MineSense needs smart and motivated people with a passion for statistics and programming. As a result, we are looking to add a a Data Science Co-op to our Data Science team based in Vancouver, BC.

Please note this role is for Students or New Graduates ONLY for an 8 to 12-month term. The deadline for applying to this position is 28th February 2025.




Job Responsibilities:
Develop machine learning models for complex sensor data to predict ore properties.
Perform data annotation for machine vision models and develop tools to accelerate and semi-automate data annotation.
Develop deep learning models for machine vision.
Work with the Sensors and GeoScience Teams to automate data processing and model training procedures.
Develop Python packages to assist in data analysis.
Statistical analysis of observational studies.
Analysis of chemometric data.





Qualifications:
Completing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering Physics, Physics, or a related field.
Experience writing scientific software in Python or R.
Experience with Git or related version control tools.
Experience applying common machine/statistical learning methods for practical data analysis.
Experience with linear and generalized linear models.
Excellent written and oral communication.

Required skills:
Programming in Python or R.
Understanding of the theory and application of common machine learning models.
Statistical design of experiments.
Data analysis (exploratory, validation, processing, modelling).

Recommended qualifications:
Programming in C++.
Experience analyzing high-dimensional data.
Experience with common geostatistical methods.
Experience with a deep learning framework (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch).








The salary offered to the successful candidate will be based on their experience, knowledge and skills they bring to MineSense, market data based on their location as well as internal equity. Keeping this mind, the salary offered can be outside of the range posted. We are looking for talented folks at all levels, so please do not hesitate to apply.

 

Our total rewards package includes: 

·        Transit Subsidy (for roles based in Vancouver, BC)

·        Hybrid work (for roles that do not require to be onsite)

·        Company organized social events and celebrations to connect with your team

 

 

Here's what you can expect as a part of the MineSense Team: 

 

When you join MineSense, a trailblazing Canadian mining technology company, you become a part of our purpose to maximize global metals and minimize global impacts. We’re not just a company; we’re a Community of Innovators who forge a path toward a sustainable future. Here’s why we want you to be excited: 

·        Purpose-Driven: At MineSense, we don’t just clock in—we live our purpose. We’re on a mission to revolutionize the  mining industry, and every day, we’re one step closer to a cleaner, greener world. 

·        Values That Resonate: Our core values—Innovation, Belonging, Resilience, and Adding Value—aren’t just buzzwords. They’re the bedrock of our culture. When you step into our team, you’re not just an employee; you’re a steward of these values. 

·        Impactful Work: Imagine contributing to a cleaner, more sustainable planet. At MineSense, you’re shaping the future of cleantech and developing cutting edge technology that literally hasn't been developed before. Your work matters, and it echoes beyond our walls. 

·        People-Centric: We’re not just about profits; we’re about people. Our organization cares deeply about its employees. When you join us, you become part of a community that supports growth, well-being, and success. 

 

Ready to make your mark? Join MineSense and be part of something bigger than yourself. 

  

MineSense is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing accommodation to individuals with disabilities. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment or hiring process, please contact us at careers@minesense.com for assistance. Information received related to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially. 

  

All applications are welcome, even if you don't meet all the requirements, so please do not hesitate to apply.

HTML:
Be part of something incredible. Metals are necessary for our world, but mining historically faced issues with waste, sustainability, and inefficiencies. MineSense is changing that. Our solutions reduce mining waste and environmental impacts while increasing profits and efficiencies. Backed by the best in venture capital and government funds, and recognized by tech industry and sustainability programs, MineSense is doing what many said could not be done: improving mining for people and planet.


Statistics and machine learning play a critical role in the development and operation of MineSense products. To help develop the software and machine learning models, MineSense needs smart and motivated people with a passion for statistics and programming. As a result, we are looking to add a a Data Science Co-op to our Data Science team based in Vancouver, BC.

Please note this role is for Students or New Graduates ONLY for an 8 to 12-month term. The deadline for applying to this position is 28th February 2025.


Job Responsibilities:
  • Develop machine learning models for complex sensor data to predict ore properties.
  • Perform data annotation for machine vision models and develop tools to accelerate and semi-automate data annotation.
  • Develop deep learning models for machine vision.
  • Work with the Sensors and GeoScience Teams to automate data processing and model training procedures.
  • Develop Python packages to assist in data analysis.
  • Statistical analysis of observational studies.
  • Analysis of chemometric data.


Qualifications:
  • Completing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering Physics, Physics, or a related field.
  • Experience writing scientific software in Python or R.
  • Experience with Git or related version control tools.
  • Experience applying common machine/statistical learning methods for practical data analysis.
  • Experience with linear and generalized linear models.
  • Excellent written and oral communication.
  • Required skills:
  • Programming in Python or R.
  • Understanding of the theory and application of common machine learning models.
  • Statistical design of experiments.
  • Data analysis (exploratory, validation, processing, modelling).
  • Recommended qualifications:
  • Programming in C++.
  • Experience analyzing high-dimensional data.
  • Experience with common geostatistical methods.
  • Experience with a deep learning framework (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch).



The salary offered to the successful candidate will be based on their experience, knowledge and skills they bring to MineSense, market data based on their location as well as internal equity. Keeping this mind, the salary offered can be outside of the range posted. We are looking for talented folks at all levels, so please do not hesitate to apply.

 

Our total rewards package includes: 

·        Transit Subsidy (for roles based in Vancouver, BC)

·        Hybrid work (for roles that do not require to be onsite)

·        Company organized social events and celebrations to connect with your team

 

 

Here's what you can expect as a part of the MineSense Team: 

 

When you join MineSense, a trailblazing Canadian mining technology company, you become a part of our purpose to maximize global metals and minimize global impacts. We’re not just a company; we’re a Community of Innovators who forge a path toward a sustainable future. Here’s why we want you to be excited: 

·        Purpose-Driven: At MineSense, we don’t just clock in—we live our purpose. We’re on a mission to revolutionize the  mining industry, and every day, we’re one step closer to a cleaner, greener world. 

·        Values That Resonate: Our core values—Innovation, Belonging, Resilience, and Adding Value—aren’t just buzzwords. They’re the bedrock of our culture. When you step into our team, you’re not just an employee; you’re a steward of these values. 

·        Impactful Work: Imagine contributing to a cleaner, more sustainable planet. At MineSense, you’re shaping the future of cleantech and developing cutting edge technology that literally hasn't been developed before. Your work matters, and it echoes beyond our walls. 

·        People-Centric: We’re not just about profits; we’re about people. Our organization cares deeply about its employees. When you join us, you become part of a community that supports growth, well-being, and success. 

 

Ready to make your mark? Join MineSense and be part of something bigger than yourself.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Quality Verification
Description:
The Sr. Data Analyst role develops business intelligence products and leads data initiatives to enhance data maturity for our Quality Verification teams. You will use your advanced technical knowledge of SQL programming, ETL pipeline development, and data visualisation tools to analyse data and identify trends, driving decision-making across our organisation.

You will report to the Senior Analytics Manager.

What You Will Do


You will define the data analytics roadmap for some of EA's largest titles.
You will use your technical skills to develop data products that improve decision-making across the Quality Verification organization.
You will define best practices in data analytics and visualization tools.
You will create data governance practices to improve our organisation's data maturity.
You will provide coaching for Data Analyst colleagues.


The Next Great Senior Data Analyst Requires


3+ years of professional analytical experience.
Advanced SQL skills and practical experience in other languages such as R, SAS, or Python.
Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
Able to plan and prioritise multiple concurrent projects.
Able to foster working relationships with partners.


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs). BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$89,300 - $123,000 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

Title: Data Analytics Co-op
Description:
Co-op Start Date: April 14, 2025

Duration: 8 months

Positions available: 1

Are you eager to get hands-on experience with innovative talent technology tools used by a global company? This is your chance! As a Co-op student on our Global Talent Technology & Attraction team based in Vancouver, you'll be at the forefront of supporting multiple geographically dispersed client groups. Gain valuable experience in application configuration, deployment, data analysis, and operational support, impacting the entire employee lifecycle!

Our ideal candidate has a high level of attention to detail and can use their data analysis skills to identify areas for process optimization. Their technical background in data preparation, analysis and visualization will be instrumental in creating insightful Power BI dashboards to support our global client groups.

Responsibilities


Evaluate, configure, deploy, and support commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) products, while resolving critical application errors and incoming support tickets.
Gather, extract and clean data from various sources, ensuring data integrity and quality.
Analyze large datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for improvement.
Convert data-driven insights into practical business suggestions, assisting collaborators in comprehending and addressing key challenges and opportunities.
Build visually appealing and insightful data visualizations in Power BI to communicate sophisticated data analysis results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability by conducting regular data audits and performing validation checks.
Continuously seek and implement improvements in data collection, analysis, and reporting to enhance overall efficiency and effectiveness.


Qualifications


Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s program in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proficient in Python, with experience in libraries such as pandas, NumPy, matplotlib, and seaborn for data manipulation and visualization.
Basic knowledge of relational databases and SQL for data querying.
Experience creating dashboards and reports using Power BI or similar business intelligence tools.
Experience in front-line customer service or technical support, with superb communication skills to convey technical concepts to non-technical collaborators.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to tackle challenges and seek guidance when needed.
Must be enrolled in a recognized and accredited co-op program at a Canadian post-secondary institution throughout the duration of the term, available for full-time work, and willing to relocate to Vancouver, BC if currently studying outside of Metro Vancouver.


Nice to Have


Understanding of how to use RESTful APIs. Familiarity with authorization frameworks (e.g., OAuth 2.0, SAML 2.0, SCIM).
Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and their benefits, enabling effective collaboration, adaptability, and continuous improvement within a team environment.
Familiarity with Azure DevOps and other agile tools for project management.


Why consider Teck Resources Limited for your Co-op Placement?

At Teck, we offer more than just a job – we provide a comprehensive student experience comprised of relevant, hands-on work, vibrant social activities, extensive networking opportunities, and rich professional development. With captivating projects set against stunning backdrops, a culture of inclusivity and collaboration, and boundless opportunities to learn, grow, and have fun, joining us means embracing a fulfilling and dynamic co-op adventure.

In addition to excellent compensation, Teck co-ops receive a variety of advantages including but not limited to: 


Financial assistance to help with travel costs and co-op fees
Opportunity to develop technical skills and gain practical experience while applying academic knowledge to real-world mining operations and projects
Enjoy mentorship and guidance from experienced specialists in their respective fields
Receive primary consideration for professional positions upon graduation


Salary Range: $3900 - $4900 / Month

Salary is commensurate with the number of academic semesters and prior co-op experiences completed.

About Teck

At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person’s unique perspective and contribution.

Teck is one of Canada's leading mining companies, focused on providing products that are essential to building a better quality of life for people around the globe.

Our commitment to our people is why Teck has been named one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for seven consecutive years, listed as one of Canada's Top Employers for Young People and named to the 2024 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index.

The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck's approach to business and we are proud to be recognized as one of the 2024 Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations by Corporate Knights.

Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.

Learn more about Teck at www.teck.com or follow @TeckResources.

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Data Engineering Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Reporting to the Manager, Data Digital Enablement, the Data Engineering Analyst will collaborate closely with the Data Architect to ensure the technical support and high availability of Seaspan Marine Group's data operations and cloud platform. This role will actively participate in maintaining and optimizing the organization’s data ecosystem. The Data Engineering Analyst demonstrates exceptional professionalism, initiative, and a proactive approach to challenges. They bring strong creative and analytical problem-solving skills, consistently deliver high-quality work within deadlines, contribute positively to team success, and embrace opportunities for continuous learning and growth.

Note: This position qualifies for an optional hybrid work schedule after 90 days of onsite work and onboarding. Employee will be subject to the terms of the Flexible Work Policy Agreement.

What You'll Do

Data Infrastructure Support


Assists in ensuring the technical support and high availability of Seaspan Marine Group's data infrastructure.
Collaborates with the Data Architect in designing, implementing, and optimizing scalable data infrastructure solutions within Microsoft's technology stack.
Monitors, troubleshoots, and debugs issues affecting the performance of the data infrastructure and its assets.
Develops root-cause analysis for incidents and contributes to lessons learned.
Supports the management and maintenance of the organization's data warehouse and lake house, ensuring its reliability, security, and operational efficiency.
Enhances existing infrastructure, solutions, and processes to meet technical standards and address business requirements.



ETL and Data Integration


Develop and supports the implementation of end-to-end ETL processes for data procurement and integration.
Collaborates with the team to continuously monitor, tune, and optimize the performance of data pipelines, databases, and datasets.
Actively participates in defining and implementing efficient data engineering workflows.



Data Modeling and Quality


Supports best practices in data modeling methodologies for the design and implementation of effective datasets.
Supports the establishment and enforcement of data quality standards and practices to ensure accuracy and reliability throughout the data life cycle.
Develops data quality monitoring, alerting, and profiling processes.
Collaborates with stakeholders to define and maintain data quality metrics and KPIs.



Documentation and Communication


Writes and maintains comprehensive documentation of the requirements collected, data infrastructure, data source catalogs, data models, ETL runbooks, and data quality standards.
Works closely with stakeholders to understand use cases and ensure developed data products meet their needs.
Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders, translating technical concepts into understandable terms.



Project Collaboration


Supports the implementation of the Data and Digital Enablement Program’s roadmap.
Participates in Scrum ceremonies as part of the Data and Digital Enablement team.
Actively contributes towards data engineering projects from conception to completion, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Works towards maintaining high standards in Seaspan Marine Group’s data engineering processes, aligning with industry best practices.



What You'll Bring


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Business Administration, or completion of a Post-secondary Diploma in Computer Science.
Minimum 2-3 years of experience as a Data Engineer in an environment using the Azure technology stack.
Familiarity with designing and building ETL mechanisms in Azure.
Proficiency in coding languages such as PowerShell, Python, SQL, Java, and Scala.
Experience using IDEs such as VS or VS Code for development and Git for version control.
Familiarity with Azure DevOps and version control practices.
Understanding of data concepts, databases, data modeling, dimensional modeling, and star schemas.
Experience with physical and logical design of database architectures for relational databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.
Knowledge of database optimization, disaster recovery, and ETL performance tuning.
Solid working knowledge in Azure Data Factory, ADLS GEN2 and TSQL.
Exposure to Spark and Databricks in Azure is an asset.
Developing and maintaining integrations in Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).
Working knowledge of Data Engineering components in Microsoft Fabric.



Why you'll love working here


This is a full-time, permanent position. With multiple operations and long-term projects, Seaspan employees enjoy job stability as we look ahead to build ships for decades to come.
In addition to an annual bonus and pension plan matching, this role provides you a very competitive salary in line with the successful candidate’s experience.
We also provide a best-in-class health and wellness benefits package for this position, including such things as full health care (e.g. unlimited physiotherapy), dental, vision, life insurance, medical leave coverage, parental leave coverage, childcare benefit partnership, wellness/fitness reimbursement for memberships or registration fees, and an Employee Family Assistance Program (EFAP).



The estimated salary for this position is $72,900 - $87,400. In determining final salary, Seaspan considers many factors including the successful Candidate’s skillset and experience as well as position location and internal equity. The final base salary offer will be at the Company’s sole discretion and presented as part of a competitive total compensation package.

About Us

With more than 130 years of experience navigating in some of the world’s most complex and difficult waters, Seaspan Marine is the largest and most diverse tug & barge company on Canada’s West Coast.

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

Title: Data Analyst Co-op - May 2025 - Demonware (Vancouver)
Description:
Job Title:

Data Analyst Co-op - May 2025 - Demonware (Vancouver)

Requisition ID:

R024743

Job Description:

Data Analyst Co-op

Demonware (Activision), Vancouver

May 2025

This role will be required to be onsite at the Demonware Vancouver office following the team's work schedule (hybrid, 3 days a week), a relocation package may be offered depending on eligibility.

The Company

Demonware is a member of the Activision family of studios. We work alongside engineers and creatives at our AAA partner studios and deliver the online and data services required by our franchises. We craft, develop, and host services for some of the worlds biggest video game franchises, including Call of Duty and Crash Bandicoot.

We are a technology company and dedicated to openness. This means collaborating to tackle problems, the freedom to talk to anyone, and the best idea wins. We take the work seriously; ourselves, not so much!

Were open to work terms of 8+ months. If you just graduated, we still want to hear from you!

Big Company Challenges, Small Company Culture

Demonware hosts millions of concurrently connected players. Some of the technologies we use are Python, Java, Linux, Vitess, Kafka, Pinot, Spark, Databricks, Tableau. We solve tough problems on a day-to-day basis, and our Co-op students have a huge impact on what we do.

Were looking for a Data Analyst to partner closely with our Product team to drive data-informed decision-making. Youll play a critical role in uncovering insights, measuring product performance, and helping shape the product roadmap. Think of yourself as the go-to person for turning raw data into actionable insights that fuel product innovation.

The Role


Analyze and interpret data from a variety of systems, including but not limited to fraud analysis, disruptive behavior, and prosocial behavior in gaming communities.
Build,maintain, and improve dashboards and reports that inform decision making and strategy.
Identify and interpret trends and anomalies in the data, and offer opinions in support of product strategy.
Filter, clean, and validate data to ensure accuracy and reliability in reporting and analysis.
Present data findings and recommendations regularly to the Product team and other stakeholders.
Proactively surface insights and recommendations to improve player experience, reduce fraud, and foster positive behavior in gaming communities.
Collaborate regularly with Activision data science/machine learning teams and game studios.
This role is part of the Demonware product team and as a result will require an inquisitive mind that cares about the why behind the data.


Requirements


Strong attention to detail.
Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).
Ability to work collaboratively with multiple teams across Activision.
Passionate about data and applying an analytical mindset to inform product decisions.
Ability to conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) and provide insights into key metrics.
A proactive attitude and eagerness to learn.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present findings in a clear and actionable way.
The ability to work well, both autonomously, as part of a larger team, and asynchronously.


Nice-to-haves


Experience with Tableau.
Experience with proposing and running experiments.
Basic understanding of Machine Learning techniques for data analysis.
Knowledge of Big Data technologies such as Spark.
Experience in using project management tools.


Perks


Complimentary breakfast, lunch, and drinks from a fully stocked kitchen
BBQs and Lunch & Learns
City-center office location
Vacation allowance
Competitive pay
Free games


How To Apply

You can apply directly through your Co-op office or directly apply at demonware.net

If you are not applying through your school program, please submit your resume, cover letter (optional but preferred) and a copy of your most recent school transcripts.

The standard base pay range for this role is 65,000 CAD annually. This value is the expected annualized base pay of interns in British Columbia, Canada. Ultimately, your offer will be based on several factors, including relevant education, performance, and work location. Your Talent Professional can share additional details for this role during the hiring process.

We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.

Our World

At Activision, we strive to create the most iconic brands in gaming and entertainment. Were driven by our mission to deliver unrivaled gaming experiences for the world to enjoy, together. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty, Crash Bandicoot, Tony Hawks Pro Skater, and Guitar Hero. As a leading worldwide developer, publisher and distributor of interactive entertainment and products, our press start is simple: delight hundreds of millions of players around the world with innovative, fun, thrilling, and engaging entertainment experiences.

Were not just looking back at our decades-long legacy; were forging ahead to keep advancing gameplay with some of the most popular titles and sophisticated technology in the world. We have bold ambitions to create the most inclusive company as we know our success comes from the passionate, creative, and diverse teams within our organization.

Were in the business of delivering fun and unforgettable entertainment for our player community to enjoy. And our future opportunities have never been greater this could be your opportunity to level up.

Ready to Activate Your Future?

The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.

We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com. General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.

Rewards

We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for 'Every World' - we've got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:


Extended health plan, including medical, dental, vision, life and AD&D insurance, for employees and their dependents, as well as disability insurance;
RRSP with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other benefit programs like supplemental life & critical illness, legal service, and others;
If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.


Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company.

The standard base pay range for this role is $45,202.50 - $95,655.00 CAD. These values reflect the expected annualized base pay range of new hires in British Columbia, Canada. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.

Job Title:

Data Analyst Co-op - May 2025 - Demonware (Vancouver)

Requisition ID:

R024743

Job Description:

Data Analyst Co-op

Demonware (Activision), Vancouver

May 2025

This role will be required to be onsite at the Demonware Vancouver office following the team's work schedule (hybrid, 3 days a week), a relocation package may be offered depending on eligibility.

The Company

Demonware is a member of the Activision family of studios. We work alongside engineers and creatives at our AAA partner studios and deliver the online and data services required by our franchises. We craft, develop, and host services for some of the worlds biggest video game franchises, including Call of Duty and Crash Bandicoot.

We are a technology company and dedicated to openness. This means collaborating to tackle problems, the freedom to talk to anyone, and the best idea wins. We take the work seriously; ourselves, not so much!

Were open to work terms of 8+ months. If you just graduated, we still want to hear from you!

Big Company Challenges, Small Company Culture

Demonware hosts millions of concurrently connected players. Some of the technologies we use are Python, Java, Linux, Vitess, Kafka, Pinot, Spark, Databricks, Tableau. We solve tough problems on a day-to-day basis, and our Co-op students have a huge impact on what we do.

Were looking for a Data Analyst to partner closely with our Product team to drive data-informed decision-making. Youll play a critical role in uncovering insights, measuring product performance, and helping shape the product roadmap. Think of yourself as the go-to person for turning raw data into actionable insights that fuel product innovation.

The Role

  • Analyze and interpret data from a variety of systems, including but not limited to fraud analysis, disruptive behavior, and prosocial behavior in gaming communities.
  • Build,maintain, and improve dashboards and reports that inform decision making and strategy.
  • Identify and interpret trends and anomalies in the data, and offer opinions in support of product strategy.
  • Filter, clean, and validate data to ensure accuracy and reliability in reporting and analysis.
  • Present data findings and recommendations regularly to the Product team and other stakeholders.
  • Proactively surface insights and recommendations to improve player experience, reduce fraud, and foster positive behavior in gaming communities.
  • Collaborate regularly with Activision data science/machine learning teams and game studios.
  • This role is part of the Demonware product team and as a result will require an inquisitive mind that cares about the why behind the data.

Requirements

  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).
  • Ability to work collaboratively with multiple teams across Activision.
  • Passionate about data and applying an analytical mindset to inform product decisions.
  • Ability to conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) and provide insights into key metrics.
  • A proactive attitude and eagerness to learn.
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to present findings in a clear and actionable way.
  • The ability to work well, both autonomously, as part of a larger team, and asynchronously.

Nice-to-haves

  • Experience with Tableau.
  • Experience with proposing and running experiments.
  • Basic understanding of Machine Learning techniques for data analysis.
  • Knowledge of Big Data technologies such as Spark.
  • Experience in using project management tools.

Perks

  • Complimentary breakfast, lunch, and drinks from a fully stocked kitchen
  • BBQs and Lunch & Learns
  • City-center office location
  • Vacation allowance
  • Competitive pay
  • Free games

How To Apply

You can apply directly through your Co-op office or directly apply at demonware.net

If you are not applying through your school program, please submit your resume, cover letter (optional but preferred) and a copy of your most recent school transcripts.

The standard base pay range for this role is 65,000 CAD annually. This value is the expected annualized base pay of interns in British Columbia, Canada. Ultimately, your offer will be based on several factors, including relevant education, performance, and work location. Your Talent Professional can share additional details for this role during the hiring process.

We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! Our World

As a leading worldwide developer, publisher and distributor of interactive entertainment and products, our press start is simple: delight hundreds of millions of players around the world with innovative, fun, thrilling, and engaging entertainment experiences.

  • Extended health plan, including medical, dental, vision, life and AD&D insurance, for employees and their dependents, as well as disability insurance;
  • RRSP with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in Vancouver, Canada in 2003, Plenty of Fish is one of the early pioneers in the online dating industry, with one of the largest and most diverse communities of singles. We're one of the top revenue-driving brands in the Match Group (comprised of Tinder, OkCupid, Hinge and Match.com).

We love what we do, and have the ability to profoundly impact millions of people's lives every single day! Named one of BC’s Top Employers, Plenty of Fish is a great place to build friendships, grow your career and collaborate with top talent.

We work hybrid at Plenty of Fish - IRL in our downtown Vancouver office on Tuesday and Wednesday and work remotely the remainder of the week!




We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to uncover engagement trends, optimize user experience, and shape product strategy at POF. If you thrive on solving complex problems, analyzing large datasets, and translating insights into compelling stories, we want to hear from you!

Your primary focus will be user engagement, but you’ll also collaborate with teams across monetization, marketing, and trust & safety, working alongside data analysts in those areas.

You’ll lead experimentation efforts, designing and analyzing A/B tests to enhance user retention and product performance. Partnering with Product Managers, Engineers, UX Designers, and Data Engineers, you’ll translate data into actionable strategies and present insights to executives to drive high-impact decisions.

As part of Match Group, you’ll also connect with data professionals across other leading dating brands, gaining exposure to industry best practices and expanding your expertise.




So, what will you do?
Design, execute, and analyze experiments to improve user engagement and retention
Work with large-scale datasets to uncover user behaviour trends and optimize key features
Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for product teams and executives
Partner with Product, Engineering, UX, and Marketing to drive data-informed decision-making
Work alongside other data analysts supporting monetization, marketing, and trust & safety
Present findings to leadership, shaping company-wide initiatives and priorities




You'll be a match for this role if you have..
4+ years of experience in data analytics, preferably in tech, SaaS, or consumer-facing platforms
Experience with raw clickstream data (telemetry event data) and handling datasets of 100M+ records
Strong expertise in A/B testing, experimentation methodologies, and statistical analysis
Proficiency in SQL and experience with Python for data analysis
Experience working with large-scale datasets in a fast-moving, data-rich environment
Strong business intuition - the ability to connect the dots between data and strategy
Excellent communication skills - comfortable presenting insights to leadership







**We would love to hear from you, even if you don't match 100% of the requirements**

Why Plenty of Fish?

• We're recognized as one of BC's Top Employers 2023!

• Generous vacation, flex days, professional development days 

• RRSP matching, and employee stock purchase plan 

• Professional development budget and unlimited access to Udemy from day one

• Match Group mentorship program

• Parental leave top up and fertility preservation benefits

• Extended health & dental benefits from day one

• Corporate ClassPass membership and other wellness benefits 

• And many more on our careers page

Our Values

• Be Proud - We own our ship. We see challenges as opportunities and take action.

• Make Waves - We profoundly impact millions of peoples' lives, every day.

• Dive Deep - We empathize with our members and use data to surface thoughtful decisions.

• Crew Together - We're all working towards the same goals and win as a team.

Want To Dive Deeper?

LinkedIn

Glassdoor

We’re committed to creating an equal and inclusive environment; we welcome all crew (and prospective crew) members regardless of race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, political belief, religion, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, conviction unrelated to employment, or any other prohibited ground of discrimination recognized by applicable law.  Plenty of Fish is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please speak to your recruiter directly.

#PoF



Factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations may influence base pay offered. This salary range is reflective of a position based in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Title: Data Analytics Specialist, Supply Planning
Description:
Department: Supply Planning

Reports to: Director, Supply Planning

Your opportunity at ARC’TERYX:

The Digital Analytics Specialist, Supply Planning works with cross-functional teams to analyze data, monitor performance metrics, and provide valuable insights to enhance overall supply planning performance. You will contribute to the achievement of KPI goals, identify areas for improvement, and support data-driven decision-making across various departments.

 

This role is based out of our North Vancouver office and is open to hybrid or remote work. Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.

 

Meet your future team:

The Supply Planning team is dynamic group of high-level planners who are responsible for the development and on-time delivery of the supply plan to warehouse.  Our planners partner with internal and external teams to identify and mitigate supply risks, manage production readiness, prioritize business requirements, and reconcile gaps in delivery.




If you were in this position now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:
Gathering business questions and translating them into data requirements and specifications
Extracting and analyzing data from various platforms, such as SAP, AFO, and other data collection platforms
Monitoring and analyzing supply chain data performance to KPIs to identify opportunities for improvement and risks in on time delivery
Preparing regular reports and dashboards summarizing key findings, insights, and recommendations for stakeholders and management to inform decision-making processes
Developing and maintaining documentation of analyses and insights to continuously build and develop data analysis process across supply planning
Monitoring and reporting on outcomes of improvements and progress against performance goals
Conducting ad hoc analysis, as required, for cross-functional partners to drive end to end Supply Chain on time delivery
Supporting training of colleagues and internal partners in their use of digital analytics to answer their business questions and develop standardized analytics processes
Working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and integrity across systems and analysis data points




Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:
Evaluating data-related process gaps across the Supply Planning and cross-functional departments, summarizing and proposing recommendations to Supply leaders for continuous process evolution
Contributing to the evolution of data tools across the business, providing subject matter expertise in future development of data platforms




Are you our next Data Analytics Specialist, Supply Planning?
You have 4+ years of experience as a Digital Analyst or similar role, preferably within supply chain
You have a University degree in Math, Economic, Statistics, Finance, Business or equivalent
You have strong analytical skills with a proven track record of collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data sets
You have an understanding of and sensitivity towards data integrity and cleanliness
You have strong expertise in SAP systems, particularly SAP Retail, SAP ERP, and SAP Master Data Governance (MDG).
High proficiency in data analysis, reporting, and visualization tools such as Excel, Tableau, or Power BI.
You have an extreme attention to detail and an ability to dig into large amounts of data and find the inconsistencies and risks
You have strong communication and business presentation skills, ability to effectively communicate to all levels of stakeholders
Familiarity with retail operations, including product management, pricing, and supply chain processes, is highly desirable.
You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions
You remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity
You are able to balance autonomy and collaboration
You inspire breakthrough thinking and continuous improvement
You seek the best (but sometimes not the easiest) solutions, with an unwavering commitment
Your passion for your work is paralleled by your passion for getting outside and living it







Equal Opportunity

Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance. 

Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.  

All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.

Leave it Better

We believe that the mountains transform us, that how we adventure matters, and that there’s always a better way. 

Join us in creating positive change in ourselves, our communities, and the world. 

Live it. Get out there - the mountains make us better 

Disruptive evolution. In pursuit of better. Always. 

Commit. We set bold objectives and see them through. 



A reasonable estimate of the pay range is CAD$70,000 - CAD$97,000 at the time of this posting. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training.

Please note that the range details above reflect the base pay only and does not include our competitive bonus program and benefits that we offer.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Cloud Control Engineering
Description:
Back to search results

Previous job Next job

Job Summary

Job Description

The Opportunity

Join an innovative team as a Data Analyst in the Cloud Control Engineering team at RBC. In this role, you will be an integral part of managing and building our program KRIs. We are looking for a passionate and creative Data Analyst who is excited about problem-solving and working with the latest technologies.

As a member of our team, you will collaborate closely with Risk, SREs, Platform Engineers, Architects, and Security Professionals. Your contributions will be vital in maintaining and enhancing our program's compliance across an agile framework. Additionally, you will participate in a support on-call rotation, demonstrating flexibility and dedication to our 24/7 operational needs.

What will you do?


Analyze structured and unstructured data using statistical techniques and create dashboards & reports in visualization tools
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data streams
Manage and support the development and implementation of Key Risk Indicators (KRI) & Metric processes for the cloud program
Collaborate with technical teams to keep key metrics and KRIs in green
Guide technical teams, provide education and thought leadership
Utilize the latest technologies available, design, and build data solutions to meet business needs
Take ownership and have ability to effectively collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams to drive work to completion under restrictive timelines. Has creativity, energy, and passion for leveraging technology to transform our industry; the belief that automation is the only way and the ability to talk for hours as to why.
Thrive on challenges and have a proven ability to set ambitious but achievable goals and surpass them.
At RBC, we work together. You will be the type of person that brings that approach to your work. You will have a proven ability to build, grow, and maintain relationships both internally and externally.


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


A relevant degree or certificate in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or a comparable field of study, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience using tools like Splunk, ELK, Tableau to visualize and report data.
Experience in coding with a variety of languages like Python, Scala, or Java.
Experience with relational databases and NoSQL data stores.
Experience with scheduling tools, such as Air Flow.


Nice To Have


Experience with control frameworks (e.g., CSA, NIST, Custom) and/or Regulatory Audits.
Experience working in a large enterprise organization and/or Financial Sector Institution.
An understanding of cloud and experience working with cloud technologies


RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Job Description

The Opportunity

Join an innovative team as a Data Analyst in the Cloud Control Engineering team at RBC. In this role, you will be an integral part of managing and building our program KRIs. We are looking for a passionate and creative Data Analyst who is excited about problem-solving and working with the latest technologies.

As a member of our team, you will collaborate closely with Risk, SREs, Platform Engineers, Architects, and Security Professionals. Your contributions will be vital in maintaining and enhancing our program's compliance across an agile framework. Additionally, you will participate in a support on-call rotation, demonstrating flexibility and dedication to our 24/7 operational needs.

What will you do?

  • Analyze structured and unstructured data using statistical techniques and create dashboards & reports in visualization tools
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data streams
  • Manage and support the development and implementation of Key Risk Indicators (KRI) & Metric processes for the cloud program
  • Collaborate with technical teams to keep key metrics and KRIs in green
  • Guide technical teams, provide education and thought leadership
  • Utilize the latest technologies available, design, and build data solutions to meet business needs
  • Take ownership and have ability to effectively collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams to drive work to completion under restrictive timelines. Has creativity, energy, and passion for leveraging technology to transform our industry; the belief that automation is the only way and the ability to talk for hours as to why.
  • Thrive on challenges and have a proven ability to set ambitious but achievable goals and surpass them.
  • At RBC, we work together. You will be the type of person that brings that approach to your work. You will have a proven ability to build, grow, and maintain relationships both internally and externally.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • A relevant degree or certificate in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or a comparable field of study, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience using tools like Splunk, ELK, Tableau to visualize and report data.
  • Experience in coding with a variety of languages like Python, Scala, or Java.
  • Experience with relational databases and NoSQL data stores.
  • Experience with scheduling tools, such as Air Flow.

Nice To Have

  • Experience with control frameworks (e.g., CSA, NIST, Custom) and/or Regulatory Audits.
  • Experience working in a large enterprise organization and/or Financial Sector Institution.
  • An understanding of cloud and experience working with cloud technologies

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Title: Data Analyst - Senior
Description:
At Lumenalta, we create impactful software solutions that drive innovation and transform businesses. Since 2000, we’ve partnered with visionary leaders to build cutting-edge tech, solve complex challenges, and deliver results faster through our elite teams and tech-driven approach. Join us in shaping the future of technology.




What we're working on:

Enterprise companies turn to us to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. The problems we solve daily are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. To grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally, you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.




Responsibilities

Design and build visually impactful dashboards and reports using Power BI and Tableau.
Migrate and integrate legacy Tableau systems into Power BI, ensuring consistency and usability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data solutions.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and accuracy through thorough validation and testing.




Requirements

7+ years experience as a data analyst.
Expertise in Power BI and Tableau (experience with both is ideal; proficiency in at least one is required).
Strong understanding of data visualization best practices.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and managing datasets.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in English.
Industry experience in Financial Services is a plus.
Personality traits: detail-oriented, proactive, problem solver, collaborative, passionate about data.




Why Lumenalta is an amazing place to work at

At Lumenalta, you can expect that you will:

Be 100% dedicated to one project at a time so that you can innovate and grow.
Be a part of a team of talented and friendly senior-level developers.
Work on projects that allow you to use leading tech.




The result? We produce meaningful outcomes for our clients that break barriers in their industries.




The job is 100% Remote; please ensure you have a comfortable office set at your desired work location.




Lumenalta is committed to hiring exceptional talent from a wide variety of diverse backgrounds. If you share our values and enthusiasm for digital transformation, we encourage you to apply

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
Marketing Statement

Join a company that has been a part of moving Metro Vancouver for over 35 years.

British Columbia Rapid Transit Company Ltd. (BCRTC) maintains and operates the Expo and Millennium SkyTrain Lines from our central facilities in south Burnaby. Our services connect downtown Vancouver to the cities of Burnaby, New Westminster, Coquitlam, Port Moody and Surrey. With the future expansion of both the Expo and Millennium Lines gathering pace, infrastructure renewal and new asset acquisition projects underway, this is an exciting time to join our team of over 1,200 dedicated employees, working on one of the longest fully-automated rapid transit systems in the world.

Our work encompasses roles such as administration, engineering, elevator and escalator maintenance, field operations, vehicle maintenance, and wayside (station and guideway) maintenance.

When you work for SkyTrain, not only will you help move Metro Vancouver, you will also have access to comprehensive benefits including paid vacation, medical benefits, transit passes, training and more. We are a proud equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Come explore what makes us one of BC’s Top Employers!

Responsibilities

PRIMARY PURPOSE

Develops, coordinates and maintains performance measures across the organization to ensure alignment with corporate

goals and objectives. Prepares a variety of analyses and reports to provide accurate and up-to-date information to the

management team.

Develops and maintains end-to-end data and analytics solutions to meet BCRTC’s business needs and support data-driven decision-making strategies. This includes identifying analytical goals and objectives through stakeholder engagement, developing data collection solutions, creating automated Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) processes, generating meaningful performance insights, and communicating analytical insights to various stakeholders through data visualization tools and data storytelling.

Key Accountabilities

Performance Measures & Continuous Improvement:

Collaborates with departments to explore data requirements and works with relevant managers/supervisors to develop business performance tracking and analytical solutions across all functions. Engages with relevant stakeholders in requirements gathering, data tracking, report design, delivery and sustainment.

Investigates and analyzes statistics and underlying causes and trends of business performance. Prepares periodic reports indicating business performance compared to targets and the previous year(s), and rationale for variances. Supports all corporate KPI reporting activities for various levels of management, BCRTC Board of Directors, and TransLink.

Establishes and maintains data collection, verification, and reporting processes which ensures timeliness, accuracy, and completeness of the analytical insights. Ensures solutions are reliable and comply with company’s standards, policies, processes, regulatory and other related requirements.

Leverages available benchmarking resources for best practices and provides comparable performance measures from other transit agencies and business enterprises to the concerned stakeholders towards informed decision making. Participates in annual benchmarking KPI data submission activities.

Supports corporate data & insights-driven initiatives and business planning activities as needed, e.g. Annual Performance Target Setting, Data Quality Improvement, Data Value Creation Initiatives and Data Management framework.

Supports the design, implementation, and maintenance of pipelines for data integration and ETL/ELT on modern data platforms such as Microsoft Azure Synapse, Fabric, and PowerBI.

Supports the manager to produce reports and statistical analyses for targeted areas in response to requests from media, Freedom of Information requests, Executive team, BCRTC management and supervisors.

Business Intelligence & Analytics (BI&A) Services

Provides analytical services as requested from leaders across the organization on divisional and departmental level BI&A reporting, business process digitization and automation. Ensures end users have the information needed to manage their business performance to support a culture of continuous improvement.

Designs, implements, and maintains end-to-end analytical solutions for BCRTC internal clients using modern BI platforms such as Microsoft Azure Synapse, Fabric, PowerApp, PowerAutomate, and Power BI. Ensures designed solutions are fit for purpose, cost-effective, align with standards, policies and support ongoing data & insights-driven initiatives within BCRTC. Ensures that solutions are reusable and scalable following best practices, balancing immediate short-term and long-term benefits.

Processes sensitive workforce data and develops relevant BI solutions according to enterprise policies and guidelines. Supports the completion of requisite Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA) completion for the developed data and analytics solutions.

Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

The requirements for this job are acquired through completion of a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Management, Data Analytics, Engineering, or other relevant business-related fields plus four (4) years of experience with development and analysis of performance measurements, and technical experience with design, implementation and maintenance of data and creation of reports in a Business Intelligence environment. Master’s, Doctorate degrees, and Professional Certifications in related fields may be considered as equivalent to practical experience. Experience supporting data management or data governance programs, or in workforce-related analytics for occupational health, safety, workforce productivity and other HR analytics would be considered an asset.

Other Requirements

Solid understanding of concepts, principles, practices and techniques pertaining to all aspects of performance measures, benchmarking, balanced scorecards and dashboards.

Advanced knowledge of developing Microsoft Analytics solutions including PowerApps, Power Automate, Power BI, Azure Synapse and Fabric. Demonstrated experience in programming languages is required: e.g. SQL, R, Python.

Strong analytical, problem solving and judgment skills to be able to interpret data and diagnose data quality issues.

Strong time management, organization, verbal and written communication skills

Strong relationship management skills and ability to work across multidisciplinary teams and management levels

Ability to multi-task, manage multiple priorities and work in a rapidly changing and dynamic environment with limited supervision

Ability to listen and interpret stakeholder feedback to understand business processes and identify business issues/objectives.

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Resident

This position works predominately on-site.

Rate of Pay

Salary: $75,600 - $113,400 per annum (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity).

The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How To Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: January 09, 2025

Closing Date: Open Until Filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

SkyTrain is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.

Title: Data Research Technician
Description:
Department: Water Services

Employee Group: Teamsters Local 31

Location: 4515 Central Boulevard, Burnaby

Salary Range/ Wage Rate: PG T18 $2,410.63 - $2,837.65 bi-weekly




Our Water Services Department is seeking a Data Research Technician who will maintain and analyze water system data, prepare detailed reports, and contribute to the accuracy and efficiency of our water management operations. The successful candidate will manage statistical data, identify trends and anomalies, and develop tools to support decision-making processes within the department.




You are: detail-oriented, analytical, and proficient in working with data and software tools, this role offers an excellent opportunity to apply your skills in maintaining and analyzing water system data. You will play a critical part in ensuring accurate reporting, identifying trends and anomalies, and contributing to the efficient management of water systems.




This role:

Updates and maintains a wide variety of statistical water system spreadsheets relating to water flow, consumption, water levels, population, reservoir levels, etc.; enters, edits, manipulates and extracts data, modifies spreadsheet formulas, sets up report and graph formats; executes water distribution network analysis program, as directed.




Prepares analyses of current water consumption trends and water flow information using established computer spreadsheets and/or programs; produces graphs, tables and charts relative to same.




Gathers, interprets, reviews and analyzes data to establish missing data points, to determine time error adjustments, and to detect anomalies and possible problems with data and/or measuring equipment and/or computer calculations; prepares data in form of tabulated spreadsheets or graphs; documents procedures used in manipulating and adjusting data.




Modifies existing programs and/or develops short, non complex programs, utilizing existing spreadsheet and/or database management software, to evaluate and process task specific data, as directed.




Prepares reports, as required, on matters such as statistical and historical data results; researches topics related to water systems, as directed.




Performs related work as required.




To be successful, you have:

Completion of Grade 12 supplemented by courses in mathematics, hydraulics, computer software programming, and/or statistics; graduation from a two‑year diploma program in Engineering Technology preferred, plus sound related experience; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.




Sound knowledge of the practices and procedures of using computer spreadsheet software and other computer applications related to the work performed.




Sound knowledge of office practices, procedures and policies of the Engineering Department as they relate to the work performed.




Working knowledge of basic research techniques, statistical analysis and engineering mathematics.




Ability to update and maintain a wide variety of statistical water system spreadsheets to enter, edit, manipulate and extract data, to modify formulas, and set up report and graph formats.




Ability to extract, interpret, review and analyze data relative to water consumption trends and related information, using established computer programs, to produce graphs and charts and to manipulate data.




Ability to modify existing programs and/or develop short, non‑complex programs as directed.




Ability to prepare reports and conduct research on topics related to the work, as directed.




Skill in the use of technical and office equipment used in the work.




Our Vision:

Metro Vancouver embraces collaboration and innovation in providing sustainable regional services that contribute to a livable and resilient region and a healthy natural environment for current and future generations.




Metro Vancouver employees proudly serve the region and demonstrate the behaviours and attributes of six leadership competencies: Accountability, Adaptability, Building and Nurturing Relationships, Communication, Continuous Learning, and Strategic Thinking and Action.




At Metro Vancouver, we are committed to cultivating a diverse, safe, equitable, and inclusive work environment for all. We strive to attract and retain a talented, diverse workforce that is reflective of the region we serve. If an accommodation is required during the recruitment and selection process, please contact careers@metrovancouver.org for support. Learn more about our commitments to diversity, equity, and inclusion here.




Please follow this link https://metrovancouver.org/about-us/careers to our Careers page where you can submit your application by February 20, 2025.
